The Ukrainian Army is encountering an array of challenges that has complicated the early stages of its counteroffensive, especially the large swaths of minefields. But its leaders are urging patience, insisting the main push is yet to come.

header: Putin Says Russia Is United Behind Him, After Quelling Rebellion.
desc: President Vladimir V. Putin spoke angrily of those who want “Russians to fight each other,” but his former ally, Yevgeny V. Prigozhin, said the mutiny he led was not a coup attempt.
author: Valerie Hopkins
text: Putin Says Russia Is United Behind Him, After Quelling Rebellion. President Vladimir V. Putin spoke angrily of those who want “Russians to fight each other,” but his former ally, Yevgeny V. Prigozhin, said the mutiny he led was not a coup attempt.

header: Revolt Raises Searing Question: Could Putin Lose Power?.

text: Revolt Raises Searing Question: Could Putin Lose Power?. Russians with ties to the Kremlin expressed relief that the mercenary leader’s mutiny did not spark a civil war. But they agreed that Vladimir Putin had come off looking weak in a way that could be lasting.

text: For Ukraine’s Jews, the Threat of War Stirs Memories of Past Horrors. In Odessa, Jewish leaders are preparing for the worst: hiring security guards, scoping out bomb shelters and making plans to evacuate if Russia invades the country.

header: Putin Announces Start to ‘Military Operation’ Against Ukraine.
desc: “The invasion has begun,” Ukraine’s Interior Ministry said. Putin says he seeks “demilitarization” of Ukraine but has no plans to occupy it.
author: Anton Troianovski and Neil MacFarquhar
text: Putin Announces Start to ‘Military Operation’ Against Ukraine. “The invasion has begun,” Ukraine’s Interior Ministry said. Putin says he seeks “demilitarization” of Ukraine but has no plans to occupy it.

header: Ukraine Enclaves Long Steeped in Conflict Face New Peril.
desc: A decision by Russia to recognize two separatist territories and order in troops raises the risks of intensified fighting in an already fraught region where violence has defined life for nearly a decade.
author: Andrew E. Kramer
text: Ukraine Enclaves Long Steeped in Conflict Face New Peril. A decision by Russia to recognize two separatist territories and order in troops raises the risks of intensified fighting in an already fraught region where violence has defined life for nearly a decade.

header: The Limits of a Europe Whole and Free.
desc: Vladimir Putin sets down a marker in Ukraine. Does the West have the means to stop him?
author: Roger Cohen
text: The Limits of a Europe Whole and Free. Vladimir Putin sets down a marker in Ukraine. Does the West have the means to stop him?

header: Many Russians Feel a Deep Unease Over Going to War.
desc: After months of tuning out American warnings that Vladimir Putin was preparing to invade Ukraine, Russians now realize that “this is not a game.”
author: Anton Troianovski
text: Many Russians Feel a Deep Unease Over Going to War. After months of tuning out American warnings that Vladimir Putin was preparing to invade Ukraine, Russians now realize that “this is not a game.”

header: Zelensky makes a dramatic appeal to the Russian people, saying ‘the people of Ukraine want peace.’.
author: Valerie Hopkins
text: Zelensky makes a dramatic appeal to the Russian people, saying ‘the people of Ukraine want peace.’.

header: Russian Mercenaries Have Covertly Entered Separatist Enclaves in Ukraine.
desc: Two senior European security officials say that the paramilitary fighters are inside the rebel territories of Ukraine to lay the groundwork for war.
author: Michael Schwirtz and Eric Schmitt
text: Russian Mercenaries Have Covertly Entered Separatist Enclaves in Ukraine. Two senior European security officials say that the paramilitary fighters are inside the rebel territories of Ukraine to lay the groundwork for war.

header: Cyberattack hits several Ukrainian government websites.
author: Valerie Hopkins
text: Cyberattack hits several Ukrainian government websites.

header: Ukraine’s president calls up reserves, urging his compatriots to fight for their country.
desc: Volodymyr Zelensky said his government would work to “raise the preparedness of the Ukrainian army to all possible changes in the operational situation.”
author: Valerie Hopkins and Maria Varenikova
text: Ukraine’s president calls up reserves, urging his compatriots to fight for their country. Volodymyr Zelensky said his government would work to “raise the preparedness of the Ukrainian army to all possible changes in the operational situation.”

header: Taiwan, eyeing parallels to Ukraine, condemns Russian invasion.
desc: Some analysts worry that a weak global response to Ukraine could embolden China’s Communist Party to ramp up pressure on self-governed Taiwan.
author: Amy Qin
text: Taiwan, eyeing parallels to Ukraine, condemns Russian invasion. Some analysts worry that a weak global response to Ukraine could embolden China’s Communist Party to ramp up pressure on self-governed Taiwan.

header: U.N. leader deepens criticism of Russia over Ukraine crisis.
desc: António Guterres said Ukraine’s sovereign territory had been violated, and he rejected Vladimir Putin’s description of Russian troops as peacekeepers.
author: Rick Gladstone
text: U.N. leader deepens criticism of Russia over Ukraine crisis. António Guterres said Ukraine’s sovereign territory had been violated, and he rejected Vladimir Putin’s description of Russian troops as peacekeepers.

header: Ukraine Girds for Kyiv Attack Amid Signs of Slowing Russian Advance.
desc: President Volodymyr Zelensky warned in a video address that Russian “sabotage groups” had entered Kyiv with the aim of decapitating his government by “destroying the head of state.”
author: Valerie Hopkins, Andrew E. Kramer and Michael Levenson
text: Ukraine Girds for Kyiv Attack Amid Signs of Slowing Russian Advance. President Volodymyr Zelensky warned in a video address that Russian “sabotage groups” had entered Kyiv with the aim of decapitating his government by “destroying the head of state.”

header: Russia Batters Ukraine With Artillery Strikes as West Condemns Invasion.
desc: Explosions were reported over Kyiv, the capital. Several countries announced severe new sanctions, as Vladimir Putin remained resolute about his decision to invade.
author: Michael Schwirtz, Eric Schmitt and Neil MacFarquhar
text: Russia Batters Ukraine With Artillery Strikes as West Condemns Invasion. Explosions were reported over Kyiv, the capital. Several countries announced severe new sanctions, as Vladimir Putin remained resolute about his decision to invade.

header: At the Polish Border, Tens of Thousands of Ukrainian Refugees.
desc: They have been warmly welcomed in a country whose border guards last year beat back mostly Afghan and Middle Eastern migrants with batons.
author: Andrew Higgins
text: At the Polish Border, Tens of Thousands of Ukrainian Refugees. They have been warmly welcomed in a country whose border guards last year beat back mostly Afghan and Middle Eastern migrants with batons.

header: Zelensky Steps Into a Role Few Expected: Ukraine’s Wartime President.
desc: Even as doubts have lingered about his preparedness to lead, Volodymyr Zelensky, a former actor, gave the performance of his life as Russian forces prepared to invade.
author: Valerie Hopkins
text: Zelensky Steps Into a Role Few Expected: Ukraine’s Wartime President. Even as doubts have lingered about his preparedness to lead, Volodymyr Zelensky, a former actor, gave the performance of his life as Russian forces prepared to invade.

header: Scenes from Kharkiv: Battle wreckage, the boom of artillery, and people sheltering in the subway.
desc: Ukrainian troops dug in around the nation’s second-largest city a day after a fight to push back advancing Russian forces.
author: Michael Schwirtz
text: Scenes from Kharkiv: Battle wreckage, the boom of artillery, and people sheltering in the subway. Ukrainian troops dug in around the nation’s second-largest city a day after a fight to push back advancing Russian forces.

header: Accurate U.S. intelligence did not stop Putin, but it gave Biden big advantages.
desc: The depth and quality of the intelligence strengthened the president’s hand in persuading allies to form a unified front against Moscow.

text: Accurate U.S. intelligence did not stop Putin, but it gave Biden big advantages. The depth and quality of the intelligence strengthened the president’s hand in persuading allies to form a unified front against Moscow.

header: Russians Now See a New Side to Putin: Dragging Them Into War.
desc: The autocrat who has steered Russia for 22 years was embraced by many Russians for what they saw as his rationality and astute risk management. That image has been upended.
author: Anton Troianovski
text: Russians Now See a New Side to Putin: Dragging Them Into War. The autocrat who has steered Russia for 22 years was embraced by many Russians for what they saw as his rationality and astute risk management. That image has been upended.

header: Russia says it won’t enter talks until Ukraine stops fighting.
desc: Russia’s foreign minister, Sergey Lavrov, made clear that Russia was seeking to topple the democratically elected government of Ukraine.
author: Anton Troianovski
text: Russia says it won’t enter talks until Ukraine stops fighting. Russia’s foreign minister, Sergey Lavrov, made clear that Russia was seeking to topple the democratically elected government of Ukraine.

header: Voices from Ukraine: ‘It’s panic.’.
desc: In one city in eastern Ukraine, there were long lines at banks and gas stations as anxious residents scrambled ahead of Russia’s invasion.
author: Michael Schwirtz
text: Voices from Ukraine: ‘It’s panic.’. In one city in eastern Ukraine, there were long lines at banks and gas stations as anxious residents scrambled ahead of Russia’s invasion.

header: Another casualty of Russia’s invasion: Ukraine’s ability to contain the coronavirus.
desc: The fighting in Ukraine’s east is forcing a hurried mass migration that leaves little room for pandemic considerations.
author: Adeel Hassan
text: Another casualty of Russia’s invasion: Ukraine’s ability to contain the coronavirus. The fighting in Ukraine’s east is forcing a hurried mass migration that leaves little room for pandemic considerations.

header: Once Sleepy and Picturesque, Ukrainian Villages Mobilize for War.
desc: While Russian assaults on Ukrainian cities have drawn most of the attention in the war’s early days, civilians in country towns have joined the fight, putting aside the routines of daily village life.
author: Maria Varenikova
text: Once Sleepy and Picturesque, Ukrainian Villages Mobilize for War. While Russian assaults on Ukrainian cities have drawn most of the attention in the war’s early days, civilians in country towns have joined the fight, putting aside the routines of daily village life.

header: Ukraine Agrees to Talks With Russia, but Fighting Still Rages.
desc: Putin, accusing the West of “aggressive statements,” puts nuclear forces on alert. Kyiv remains in Russian cross-hairs as Ukrainians push back.
author: Valerie Hopkins, Anton Troianovski and Steven Erlanger
text: Ukraine Agrees to Talks With Russia, but Fighting Still Rages. Putin, accusing the West of “aggressive statements,” puts nuclear forces on alert. Kyiv remains in Russian cross-hairs as Ukrainians push back.

header: Russia Advances on 3 Ukrainian Cities, but Meets Fierce Resistance.
desc: Ukraine’s leader said his forces had “repelled” the Russian army’s assault. Moscow claimed it had merely “paused” for the possibility of peace negotiations.
author: Valerie Hopkins, Eric Schmitt, Michael Levenson and The New York Times
text: Russia Advances on 3 Ukrainian Cities, but Meets Fierce Resistance. Ukraine’s leader said his forces had “repelled” the Russian army’s assault. Moscow claimed it had merely “paused” for the possibility of peace negotiations.

header: ‘Everybody in Our Country Needs to Defend’.
desc: Civilian volunteers and paramilitary groups are taking the fight to the Russian army in Kyiv, Ukraine’s capital.
author: Andrew E. Kramer and Lynsey Addario
text: ‘Everybody in Our Country Needs to Defend’. Civilian volunteers and paramilitary groups are taking the fight to the Russian army in Kyiv, Ukraine’s capital.

header: In Foreign Policy U-Turn, Germany Ups Military Spending and Arms Ukraine.
desc: Germany agrees to strengthen its military in the latest foreign policy about-face amid pressure from allies and horror at Russia’s attack on Ukraine.
author: Melissa Eddy
text: In Foreign Policy U-Turn, Germany Ups Military Spending and Arms Ukraine. Germany agrees to strengthen its military in the latest foreign policy about-face amid pressure from allies and horror at Russia’s attack on Ukraine.

header: Putin’s War Ushers In Crisis for Russia.
desc: Despite the Kremlin’s efforts to obscure the offensive in Ukraine, the costs of the war were already evident in both economic and social turmoil.
author: Anton Troianovski and Ivan Nechepurenko
text: Putin’s War Ushers In Crisis for Russia. Despite the Kremlin’s efforts to obscure the offensive in Ukraine, the costs of the war were already evident in both economic and social turmoil.

header: ‘I’m a Soldier Now.’ Even in Untouched Villages, Ukrainians Prepare to Fight.

author: Michael Schwirtz
text: ‘I’m a Soldier Now.’ Even in Untouched Villages, Ukrainians Prepare to Fight. In cities and towns in Central Ukraine that have not yet heard the boom of Russian artillery fire, residents spent the weekend preparing furiously for the possibly of an attack.

author: Cora Engelbrecht
text: Ukrainians in Britain Take Up the Cause Back Home. Whether vowing to kill Russians or offering medical supplies, Ukrainian citizens are too impatient to sit idly by.

header: War in Ukraine Forces Israel Into a Delicate Balancing Act.
desc: Israel is a strong ally of the United States, and its leaders have a good relationship with Volodymyr Zelensky, Ukraine’s Jewish president. But Israel also doesn’t want to provoke Russia.
author: Patrick Kingsley, Isabel Kershner and Ronen Bergman
text: War in Ukraine Forces Israel Into a Delicate Balancing Act. Israel is a strong ally of the United States, and its leaders have a good relationship with Volodymyr Zelensky, Ukraine’s Jewish president. But Israel also doesn’t want to provoke Russia.

header: Ukraine War Forces Hungary’s Orban Into Political Contortions.
desc: The pro-Russia, anti-immigrant Hungarian prime minister, who denounced any sanctions against Russia just weeks ago, has been forced to reverse himself as an election looms.
author: Benjamin Novak
text: Ukraine War Forces Hungary’s Orban Into Political Contortions. The pro-Russia, anti-immigrant Hungarian prime minister, who denounced any sanctions against Russia just weeks ago, has been forced to reverse himself as an election looms.

header: After a Fumbled Start, Russian Forces Hit Harder in Ukraine.
desc: After days of miscalculation about Ukraine’s resolve to fight, Russian forces are turning toward an old pattern of opening fire on cities and mounting sieges.
author: Steven Erlanger
text: After a Fumbled Start, Russian Forces Hit Harder in Ukraine. After days of miscalculation about Ukraine’s resolve to fight, Russian forces are turning toward an old pattern of opening fire on cities and mounting sieges.

header: Spurning Rebukes, Russia Escalates Attack on Ukraine as Refugee Ranks Swell.
desc: There was no sign of possible de-escalation on the sixth day of the invasion, as Russia appeared determined to toughen its tactics against a defiant neighbor.
author: Andrew E. Kramer, Valerie Hopkins and Nick Cumming-Bruce
text: Spurning Rebukes, Russia Escalates Attack on Ukraine as Refugee Ranks Swell. There was no sign of possible de-escalation on the sixth day of the invasion, as Russia appeared determined to toughen its tactics against a defiant neighbor.

header: Russian Rocket Barrage Kills Civilians as First Talks Show No Progress.
desc: The deadly rocket assault on a residential area of Ukraine’s second-largest city signaled an escalation of Russian tactics, and overshadowed efforts at diplomacy.
author: Valerie Hopkins, Steven Erlanger and Michael Schwirtz
text: Russian Rocket Barrage Kills Civilians as First Talks Show No Progress. The deadly rocket assault on a residential area of Ukraine’s second-largest city signaled an escalation of Russian tactics, and overshadowed efforts at diplomacy.

header: Ukraine War Sets Off Europe’s Fastest Migration in Decades.
desc: At least 660,000 people, mostly women and children, fled Ukraine in the five days after Russia invaded — the most intense wave of European migration since at least the 1990s.
author: Patrick Kingsley
text: Ukraine War Sets Off Europe’s Fastest Migration in Decades. At least 660,000 people, mostly women and children, fled Ukraine in the five days after Russia invaded — the most intense wave of European migration since at least the 1990s.

header: Invasion Brings Russia Global Repudiation With Cold War Echoes.
desc: From culture to commerce, sports to travel, the world is shunning Russia in myriad ways to protest President Vladimir V. Putin’s invasion of Ukraine.
author: Mark Landler
text: Invasion Brings Russia Global Repudiation With Cold War Echoes. From culture to commerce, sports to travel, the world is shunning Russia in myriad ways to protest President Vladimir V. Putin’s invasion of Ukraine.

header: Many nuclear power reactors in Ukraine are no longer producing electricity.
desc: Six of the 15 reactors in the country appear to be offline at the moment, with one site close to Russian troop movements reporting half of its reactors are down.
author: William J. Broad
text: Many nuclear power reactors in Ukraine are no longer producing electricity. Six of the 15 reactors in the country appear to be offline at the moment, with one site close to Russian troop movements reporting half of its reactors are down.

header: Satellite internet terminals, sent by Elon Musk, arrive in Ukraine.
desc: Responding to a plea by a Ukrainian official, Mr. Musk delivered an unknown number of his Starlink terminals, which offer online connection via orbiting satellites, bypassing conventional providers.
author: Mike Ives
text: Satellite internet terminals, sent by Elon Musk, arrive in Ukraine. Responding to a plea by a Ukrainian official, Mr. Musk delivered an unknown number of his Starlink terminals, which offer online connection via orbiting satellites, bypassing conventional providers.

header: Africans Say Ukrainian Authorities Hindered Them From Fleeing.
desc: Africans and other foreigners in Ukraine say border guards made them endure long waits and even beat them, while letting Ukrainians through quickly. Ukraine denied discriminating.
author: Monika Pronczuk and Ruth Maclean
text: Africans Say Ukrainian Authorities Hindered Them From Fleeing. Africans and other foreigners in Ukraine say border guards made them endure long waits and even beat them, while letting Ukrainians through quickly. Ukraine denied discriminating.

header: Initial talks between Russia and Ukraine yield no resolution.
desc: Russia’s delegation leader said the next meeting would take place once more along the Ukraine-Belarus border in the “coming days.”
author: Valerie Hopkins
text: Initial talks between Russia and Ukraine yield no resolution. Russia’s delegation leader said the next meeting would take place once more along the Ukraine-Belarus border in the “coming days.”

header: Watching the War in Ukraine, Taiwanese Draw Lessons in Self-Reliance.
desc: Many in Taiwan see parallels with Ukraine. “We must use this time of peace to prepare for the worst,” says a nonprofit working to promote civil defense.
author: Amy Qin and Amy Chang Chien
text: Watching the War in Ukraine, Taiwanese Draw Lessons in Self-Reliance. Many in Taiwan see parallels with Ukraine. “We must use this time of peace to prepare for the worst,” says a nonprofit working to promote civil defense.

header: On the Exodus West, Ukrainians Flee Hardship for an Uncertain Future.
desc: Many thousands of Ukrainians, fearful of the war, are leaving their homes on a slow journey west, enduring difficulties but also buoyed by the generosity of their countrymen.

text: On the Exodus West, Ukrainians Flee Hardship for an Uncertain Future. Many thousands of Ukrainians, fearful of the war, are leaving their homes on a slow journey west, enduring difficulties but also buoyed by the generosity of their countrymen.

header: Kremlin Vows Victory in Ukraine as Refugees Swell to One Million.
desc: Defiant Ukrainians slowed the invasion, but Russian forces gained ground in the south, and the Kremlin insisted the week-old campaign was “going according to plan.”

text: Kremlin Vows Victory in Ukraine as Refugees Swell to One Million. Defiant Ukrainians slowed the invasion, but Russian forces gained ground in the south, and the Kremlin insisted the week-old campaign was “going according to plan.”

header: First Ukraine City Falls as Russia Strikes More Civilian Targets.

author: Michael Schwirtz and Richard Pérez-Pena
text: First Ukraine City Falls as Russia Strikes More Civilian Targets. Russian forces seized the southern city of Kherson and besieged other cities, with casualties and destruction mounting, as Western sanctions tightened their vise grip on Russia’s economy.

header: Putin’s War to Bring Ukraine to Heel Unites Eastern Europe in Alarm.

text: Putin’s War to Bring Ukraine to Heel Unites Eastern Europe in Alarm. Many countries fear that the Russian leader’s efforts to turn back the clock and reclaim a sphere of influence lost at the end of the Cold War could spell disaster for them.

header: 15,000 Are Sheltering in Kyiv’s Subway.
desc: People sleep three or four to a mattress and plastic food bags litter the scene, while mothers search endlessly on their phones for news of the war.
author: Andrew E. Kramer and Lynsey Addario
text: 15,000 Are Sheltering in Kyiv’s Subway. People sleep three or four to a mattress and plastic food bags litter the scene, while mothers search endlessly on their phones for news of the war.

header: A War the Kremlin Tried to Disguise Becomes a Hard Reality for Russians.

text: A War the Kremlin Tried to Disguise Becomes a Hard Reality for Russians. Moscow posted a death toll from its attack on Ukraine for the first time, and Russians who long avoided politics are now grappling with the fact that their country is fighting a deadly conflict.

header: Last Vestiges of Russia’s Free Press Fall Under Kremlin Pressure.
desc: “Everything that’s not propaganda is being eliminated,” a Nobel Prize winning editor said as Russian authorities moved to control the narrative in the Ukraine war.

text: Last Vestiges of Russia’s Free Press Fall Under Kremlin Pressure. “Everything that’s not propaganda is being eliminated,” a Nobel Prize winning editor said as Russian authorities moved to control the narrative in the Ukraine war.

header: French volunteers plan to head to Ukraine to join its new foreign legion.

text: French volunteers plan to head to Ukraine to join its new foreign legion. And Ukraine is welcoming them and other volunteers with open arms.

header: Reports of civilian casualties rise in Ukraine, but exact counts remain uncertain.
desc: As is often the case in war zones, tolls diverged. It was not immediately possible for The New York Times to provide an independent estimate.
author: Emma Bubola
text: Reports of civilian casualties rise in Ukraine, but exact counts remain uncertain. As is often the case in war zones, tolls diverged. It was not immediately possible for The New York Times to provide an independent estimate.

header: More than 800 medical students, most African or Indian, are stranded in northeastern Ukraine.
desc: “It’s always one answer” for those trying to get out of the town of Sumy, said one of the students. “The roads are blocked and they are not safe.”

text: More than 800 medical students, most African or Indian, are stranded in northeastern Ukraine. “It’s always one answer” for those trying to get out of the town of Sumy, said one of the students. “The roads are blocked and they are not safe.”

header: Russian Prisoners and Ukrainian Soldiers Describe Two Sides of the Conflict.
desc: The accounts painted a picture of a conflict consisting largely of ambushes, at least in northern Ukraine where the Russian forces are striving to encircle and capture the capital, Kyiv.
author: Andrew E. Kramer
text: Russian Prisoners and Ukrainian Soldiers Describe Two Sides of the Conflict. The accounts painted a picture of a conflict consisting largely of ambushes, at least in northern Ukraine where the Russian forces are striving to encircle and capture the capital, Kyiv.

header: Russians Seize Europe’s Biggest Nuclear Plant and Gain in the South as More Ukrainians Flee.
desc: The Russian military advance in Ukraine sowed more destruction and chaos, pointing to a worsening conflict, as the Kremlin also moved to restrict how it’s reported at home.
author: Andrew E. Kramer, Michael Schwirtz and Michael Levenson
text: Russians Seize Europe’s Biggest Nuclear Plant and Gain in the South as More Ukrainians Flee. The Russian military advance in Ukraine sowed more destruction and chaos, pointing to a worsening conflict, as the Kremlin also moved to restrict how it’s reported at home.

header: Russian Forces Pound Civilians, as Putin Likens Sanctions to a ‘Declaration of War’.
desc: Despite a cease-fire, Russia shelled near humanitarian corridors meant for civilians to escape an embattled city, Ukraine says, while the Russian leader also warned about a no-fly zone.
author: Michael Schwirtz, Andrew E. Kramer and Michael Levenson
text: Russian Forces Pound Civilians, as Putin Likens Sanctions to a ‘Declaration of War’. Despite a cease-fire, Russia shelled near humanitarian corridors meant for civilians to escape an embattled city, Ukraine says, while the Russian leader also warned about a no-fly zone.

header: In Kyiv’s Railway Station, Rumors, Near-Stampedes and Frustration.
desc: As Russian forces begin to encircle the Ukrainian capital, tens of thousands are clambering for a way out that may soon be closed off.

text: In Kyiv’s Railway Station, Rumors, Near-Stampedes and Frustration. As Russian forces begin to encircle the Ukrainian capital, tens of thousands are clambering for a way out that may soon be closed off.

header: How the West Marshaled a Stunning Show of Unity Against Russia.
desc: In a few frantic days, the West threw out the playbook it used for decades against the Kremlin and isolated Russia with unparalleled sanctions and penalties.
author: Mark Landler, Katrin Bennhold and Matina Stevis-Gridneff
text: How the West Marshaled a Stunning Show of Unity Against Russia. In a few frantic days, the West threw out the playbook it used for decades against the Kremlin and isolated Russia with unparalleled sanctions and penalties.

header: The battle for a Ukraine nuclear plant was a painful reminder of the world’s worst nuclear disaster.
desc: The director general of the International Atomic Energy Agency, proposed going to Ukraine to inspect nuclear facilities. “There is no normalcy to the situation when there are military forces in charge of the site,” he said.
author: Matthew Mpoke Bigg
text: The battle for a Ukraine nuclear plant was a painful reminder of the world’s worst nuclear disaster. The director general of the International Atomic Energy Agency, proposed going to Ukraine to inspect nuclear facilities. “There is no normalcy to the situation when there are military forces in charge of the site,” he said.

header: Fire at a Ukrainian nuclear plant is out, but Russian troops take control of the site.
desc: International observers and Ukrainian officials said that as of 6 a.m. the facility was still able to function safely.
author: Marc Santora and William J. Broad
text: Fire at a Ukrainian nuclear plant is out, but Russian troops take control of the site. International observers and Ukrainian officials said that as of 6 a.m. the facility was still able to function safely.

header: Putin likens sanctions to an ‘act of war’ and warns Ukraine might lose statehood.
author: The New York Times
text: Putin likens sanctions to an ‘act of war’ and warns Ukraine might lose statehood.

header: The State of Fighting in Ukraine’s Besieged Cities.

text: The State of Fighting in Ukraine’s Besieged Cities. About two-thirds of Ukraine’s population of 44 million people lived in cities before Russia’s invasion began. Now many urban areas are in the cross-hairs of war.

header: Ukraine War Forces a Question: How Far East Does Europe Go?.
desc: After Russia invaded, Ukraine asked to join the European Union, quickly. Moldova and Georgia have asked, too. Member states would rather not answer.
author: Matina Stevis-Gridneff
text: Ukraine War Forces a Question: How Far East Does Europe Go?. After Russia invaded, Ukraine asked to join the European Union, quickly. Moldova and Georgia have asked, too. Member states would rather not answer.

header: Ukrainian Family’s Dash for Safety Ends in Death.
desc: Russian forces hit a bridge being used by civilians evacuating the fighting in Ukraine. Four people were killed.
author: Lynsey Addario and Andrew E. Kramer
text: Ukrainian Family’s Dash for Safety Ends in Death. Russian forces hit a bridge being used by civilians evacuating the fighting in Ukraine. Four people were killed.

header: Hate for Putin’s Russia Consumes Ukraine.
desc: Much of the bitterness is directed at President Vladimir V. Putin, but Ukrainians also chastise ordinary Russians, calling them complicit.
author: Maria Varenikova
text: Hate for Putin’s Russia Consumes Ukraine. Much of the bitterness is directed at President Vladimir V. Putin, but Ukrainians also chastise ordinary Russians, calling them complicit.

header: Proud Band of Ukrainian Troops Holds Russian Assault at Bay — for Now.
desc: “Few expected such strength from our people,” said a Ukrainian colonel whose soldiers have repelled a Russian attack on the port city of Mykolaiv for three days.

text: Proud Band of Ukrainian Troops Holds Russian Assault at Bay — for Now. “Few expected such strength from our people,” said a Ukrainian colonel whose soldiers have repelled a Russian attack on the port city of Mykolaiv for three days.

header: ‘Falling Into Emptiness’: Ukrainian Families Feel the Pain of Separation.

text: ‘Falling Into Emptiness’: Ukrainian Families Feel the Pain of Separation. With most Ukrainian men legally prohibited from leaving Ukraine, the international border gates serve as a painful filter, splitting families as women and children move on.

text: The third round of Ukraine-Russia talks renew the prospect of humanitarian corridors.

header: Hate for Putin and ordinary Russians consumes Ukraine.
author: Maria Varenikova

text: U.S. is exploring how to send Soviet-era fighter jets to Ukraine. The discussions follow President Volodymyr Zelensky’s impassioned plea to American legislators for assistance in obtaining more lethal military aid.

text: Ukraine takes its case against Russia to the U.N.’s highest court. The head of the Ukrainian delegation told the court that “millions are in danger” and accused Moscow of defiling the Genocide Convention.

header: They Died by a Bridge in Ukraine. This Is Their Story.

text: They Died by a Bridge in Ukraine. This Is Their Story. Tetiana Perebyinis and her two children were killed trying to dash to safety, a moment captured by our photographer. Her husband describes their lives, and their final hours.

header: Russia Bombards Ukraine Cities and Accuses U.S. of ‘Economic War’.
desc: Misery deepened in Ukraine, where millions of people were caught in besieged cities, and in Russia, where the West’s economic sanctions were biting hard.
author: Richard Pérez-Pena
text: Russia Bombards Ukraine Cities and Accuses U.S. of ‘Economic War’. Misery deepened in Ukraine, where millions of people were caught in besieged cities, and in Russia, where the West’s economic sanctions were biting hard.

header: Quoting Churchill and Shakespeare, Ukraine Leader Vows No Surrender.

text: Quoting Churchill and Shakespeare, Ukraine Leader Vows No Surrender. In a dramatic video address to Britain’s House of Commons, President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine said he would never capitulate to the invading Russians.

header: As Fighting Gets Closer, a Kyiv Hospital Treats the War’s Atrocities.
desc: As Russian bombings have grown more indiscriminate, hospitals in Ukraine have become perilous places to work.
author: Andrew E. Kramer
text: As Fighting Gets Closer, a Kyiv Hospital Treats the War’s Atrocities. As Russian bombings have grown more indiscriminate, hospitals in Ukraine have become perilous places to work.

header: After a Week of Siege, Bloodied Mariupol Plans Mass Graves.
desc: Under a relentless Russian barrage, there is no heat or electricity, and people are boiling snow for water. A 6-year-old died of dehydration, the authorities said.
author: Valerie Hopkins
text: After a Week of Siege, Bloodied Mariupol Plans Mass Graves. Under a relentless Russian barrage, there is no heat or electricity, and people are boiling snow for water. A 6-year-old died of dehydration, the authorities said.

header: Ukraine’s first lady emerges into the spotlight to condemn Russia’s invasion and plead for help.
desc: Olena Zelenska says in a letter that Russian forces are engaged in the “mass murder of civilians” and reiterates her husband’s call for a no-fly zone.
author: Valerie Hopkins
text: Ukraine’s first lady emerges into the spotlight to condemn Russia’s invasion and plead for help. Olena Zelenska says in a letter that Russian forces are engaged in the “mass murder of civilians” and reiterates her husband’s call for a no-fly zone.

header: Battlefield reports are murky, but signs of Ukraine’s successes emerge.
desc: The Ukrainian military claims to have killed thousands of Russian soldiers and destroyed hundreds of tanks and aircraft. Verifying the figures is challenging.
author: Marc Santora
text: Battlefield reports are murky, but signs of Ukraine’s successes emerge. The Ukrainian military claims to have killed thousands of Russian soldiers and destroyed hundreds of tanks and aircraft. Verifying the figures is challenging.

header: W.H.O. condemns attacks on health care services in Ukraine and calls for safe passage for medical supplies.
desc: The organization has confirmed at least 16 attacks on the medical system, which is facing urgent supply shortages.

text: W.H.O. condemns attacks on health care services in Ukraine and calls for safe passage for medical supplies. The organization has confirmed at least 16 attacks on the medical system, which is facing urgent supply shortages.

header: Moldovans Welcome Fleeing Ukrainians, but Some Pack Their Own Bags, Too.

text: Moldovans Welcome Fleeing Ukrainians, but Some Pack Their Own Bags, Too. Moldova has taken in more Ukrainians, per capita, than any other country. But the closer Russian troops get to Moldova, the more locals consider their own escape plans.

header: Ukrainians Trying to Flee to U.K. Face a Confounding Path.
desc: The government has offered a way for U.K. residents to bring over Ukrainian relatives fleeing the war. But families and rights groups say it’s a bureaucratic nightmare that makes it too difficult to get in.
author: Megan Specia
text: Ukrainians Trying to Flee to U.K. Face a Confounding Path. The government has offered a way for U.K. residents to bring over Ukrainian relatives fleeing the war. But families and rights groups say it’s a bureaucratic nightmare that makes it too difficult to get in.

header: Slowed on the Battlefield, Russia Widens Bombardment of Ukrainian Cities.
desc: But military experts, citing previous Russian campaigns, say that strategy is unlikely to succeed without bloody urban fighting.

text: Slowed on the Battlefield, Russia Widens Bombardment of Ukrainian Cities. But military experts, citing previous Russian campaigns, say that strategy is unlikely to succeed without bloody urban fighting.

header: Russia Batters and Encircles Ukrainian Cities, as Diplomacy Falters.
desc: The first meeting during the war of the two countries’ foreign ministers yielded no cease-fire. The Russian side signaled that its invasion would not stop until Ukraine surrendered.

text: Russia Batters and Encircles Ukrainian Cities, as Diplomacy Falters. The first meeting during the war of the two countries’ foreign ministers yielded no cease-fire. The Russian side signaled that its invasion would not stop until Ukraine surrendered.

header: How a Line of Russian Tanks Became an Inviting Target for Ukrainians.
desc: A skirmish in an eastern suburb of Kyiv illustrated how close Russian forces have come as they continued to tighten a noose on the city, but also revealed their strategic vulnerabilities.
author: Andrew E. Kramer
text: How a Line of Russian Tanks Became an Inviting Target for Ukrainians. A skirmish in an eastern suburb of Kyiv illustrated how close Russian forces have come as they continued to tighten a noose on the city, but also revealed their strategic vulnerabilities.

header: Russian forces are laying siege to the northern Ukraine city of Chernihiv, the mayor says.
desc: Ukrainian forces are battling to keep some roads open, as Russia tightens its cordon around the battered city. “We are surrounded,” the mayor said.
author: Marc Santora
text: Russian forces are laying siege to the northern Ukraine city of Chernihiv, the mayor says. Ukrainian forces are battling to keep some roads open, as Russia tightens its cordon around the battered city. “We are surrounded,” the mayor said.

header: ‘Free Ukraine Street’: Russian Embassies Get Pointed New Addresses.

text: ‘Free Ukraine Street’: Russian Embassies Get Pointed New Addresses. Officials in many European cities are giving streets, squares and intersections in front of Russian missions names with pro-Ukraine themes.

header: Europe’s Trains Take Fighters to Ukraine, and Bring Back Refugees.
desc: Built up over 150 years of conflicts that defined modern-day Europe, railways have played a central role in the continent’s peacetime integration. Now they’re back on a war footing.

text: Europe’s Trains Take Fighters to Ukraine, and Bring Back Refugees. Built up over 150 years of conflicts that defined modern-day Europe, railways have played a central role in the continent’s peacetime integration. Now they’re back on a war footing.

header: Russian Sieges of Ukrainian Cities Provoke Bitter Recollections for Syrians.
desc: “We feel for them and say, may God be with you,” said one Syrian who endured hunger and cold when his own government, backed by Russia, besieged Aleppo.
author: Raja Abdulrahim
text: Russian Sieges of Ukrainian Cities Provoke Bitter Recollections for Syrians. “We feel for them and say, may God be with you,” said one Syrian who endured hunger and cold when his own government, backed by Russia, besieged Aleppo.

header: Harris Tells Americans They Will Have to Pay More for Gas to Punish Russia.
desc: Vice President Kamala Harris, visiting NATO ally Romania, insisted that the higher costs of energy associated with sanctions imposed on Moscow over its war on Ukraine would be worth the pain.

text: Harris Tells Americans They Will Have to Pay More for Gas to Punish Russia. Vice President Kamala Harris, visiting NATO ally Romania, insisted that the higher costs of energy associated with sanctions imposed on Moscow over its war on Ukraine would be worth the pain.

header: Harris, in Poland, Seeks to Present United Front Against Russia.
desc: Vice President Kamala Harris visited Warsaw a day after U.S. officials said they were blindsided by Poland’s offer to provide jet fighters to Ukraine. Washington rejected it, fearing it could escalate the conflict.
author: Zolan Kanno-Youngs
text: Harris, in Poland, Seeks to Present United Front Against Russia. Vice President Kamala Harris visited Warsaw a day after U.S. officials said they were blindsided by Poland’s offer to provide jet fighters to Ukraine. Washington rejected it, fearing it could escalate the conflict.

header: Biden will call for suspending normal trade relations with Russia.
desc: The move, expected to be joined by the G7 and the European Union, would result in higher tariffs on Russian products being sent to the United States.
author: Ana Swanson and Katie Rogers
text: Biden will call for suspending normal trade relations with Russia. The move, expected to be joined by the G7 and the European Union, would result in higher tariffs on Russian products being sent to the United States.

header: U.S. to Send Arms to Ukraine, as Russia Intensifies Campaign of Destruction.
desc: A defiant mayor of a captured city was kidnapped by Russian troops, Ukrainian authorities say, an act that prompted hundreds to protest.
author: Marc Santora, Michael Schwirtz and Michael Levenson
text: U.S. to Send Arms to Ukraine, as Russia Intensifies Campaign of Destruction. A defiant mayor of a captured city was kidnapped by Russian troops, Ukrainian authorities say, an act that prompted hundreds to protest.

header: In a Kyiv Basement, 19 Surrogate Babies Are Trapped by War but Kept Alive by Nannies.
desc: Some surrogate mothers are trapped by the fighting as their due dates near. And newborns face uncertain fates, with many biological parents now unable to travel to Ukraine.

text: In a Kyiv Basement, 19 Surrogate Babies Are Trapped by War but Kept Alive by Nannies. Some surrogate mothers are trapped by the fighting as their due dates near. And newborns face uncertain fates, with many biological parents now unable to travel to Ukraine.

header: Russian Airstrike at NATO’s Doorstep Raises Fears of Expanded War.
desc: Russian missiles hit a military base being used to train foreign volunteers who want to help Ukraine repel the invasion, killing a reported 35 people just 11 miles from the Polish border.
author: Marc Santora, Jack Nicas and Eric Schmitt
text: Russian Airstrike at NATO’s Doorstep Raises Fears of Expanded War. Russian missiles hit a military base being used to train foreign volunteers who want to help Ukraine repel the invasion, killing a reported 35 people just 11 miles from the Polish border.

header: Booms, Smoke and Fire Signal Horror of Russian Attack on Base.
desc: Residents of a town near Poland’s border awoke to frightful sounds and an awareness they were no longer safe.
author: Valerie Hopkins and Yousur Al-Hlou
text: Booms, Smoke and Fire Signal Horror of Russian Attack on Base. Residents of a town near Poland’s border awoke to frightful sounds and an awareness they were no longer safe.

header: Pandemic Fears Give Way to a Rush for Bomb Shelters.
desc: Since Vladimir Putin’s invasion of Ukraine, European anxiety has shifted from Covid to nuclear annihilation. Bunkers, survival guides and iodine pills are flying off the shelves.
author: Jason Horowitz
text: Pandemic Fears Give Way to a Rush for Bomb Shelters. Since Vladimir Putin’s invasion of Ukraine, European anxiety has shifted from Covid to nuclear annihilation. Bunkers, survival guides and iodine pills are flying off the shelves.

header: The base attacked in western Ukraine has been a hub for foreign militaries.

author: Austin Ramzy
text: The base attacked in western Ukraine has been a hub for foreign militaries. The base outside Lviv that was attacked by Russian forces early on Sunday was a key link between Ukraine’s armed forces and Western militaries before the war.

header: With Bombings and a Funeral, the War Arrives in Ukraine’s West.
desc: Western Ukraine has been a safe haven for Ukrainian refugees, as well as businessmen, journalists and diplomats. But attacks in two cities pierced the sense of security in the region.
author: Valerie Hopkins
text: With Bombings and a Funeral, the War Arrives in Ukraine’s West. Western Ukraine has been a safe haven for Ukrainian refugees, as well as businessmen, journalists and diplomats. But attacks in two cities pierced the sense of security in the region.

header: Brent Renaud, an American journalist, is killed in Ukraine.
desc: An award-winning filmmaker and journalist, Mr. Renaud, 50, was killed while reporting in a suburb of Kyiv. Another journalist was wounded.
author: Michael Schwirtz
text: Brent Renaud, an American journalist, is killed in Ukraine. An award-winning filmmaker and journalist, Mr. Renaud, 50, was killed while reporting in a suburb of Kyiv. Another journalist was wounded.

header: Shelling damages a revered monastery, and injures some seeking shelter there.
desc: The 16th-century monastery is one of the three most sacred sites in Ukraine for Orthodox believers.
author: Andrew E. Kramer
text: Shelling damages a revered monastery, and injures some seeking shelter there. The 16th-century monastery is one of the three most sacred sites in Ukraine for Orthodox believers.

header: Chaos of War in Ukraine Could Fuel New Covid Surge, Doctors Say.
desc: War has pushed Covid out of people’s minds while forcing them into crowded and unsanitary conditions that are fertile ground for the coronavirus, polio and other pathogens.
author: Carlotta Gall
text: Chaos of War in Ukraine Could Fuel New Covid Surge, Doctors Say. War has pushed Covid out of people’s minds while forcing them into crowded and unsanitary conditions that are fertile ground for the coronavirus, polio and other pathogens.

header: Diplomacy Quickens to Halt Ukraine War or Stop Its Expansion.
desc: Ukraine and Russia held a new round of talks and agreed to resume them on Tuesday, as the United States warned China about helping an increasingly isolated Kremlin and expanding the conflict.
author: Mark Landler and David E. Sanger
text: Diplomacy Quickens to Halt Ukraine War or Stop Its Expansion. Ukraine and Russia held a new round of talks and agreed to resume them on Tuesday, as the United States warned China about helping an increasingly isolated Kremlin and expanding the conflict.

header: China Sees at Least One Winner Emerging From Ukraine War: China.

text: China Sees at Least One Winner Emerging From Ukraine War: China. The country’s leaders think it can shield itself from economic and diplomatic fallout and eventually be seen as a pillar of stability.

header: ‘I’m Not Scared of Anything’: Death and Defiance in a Besieged Ukrainian City.
desc: The port city of Mykolaiv is being shelled by Russian forces every day. Bodies are piled at the morgue. But residents refuse to succumb.
author: NA
text: ‘I’m Not Scared of Anything’: Death and Defiance in a Besieged Ukrainian City. The port city of Mykolaiv is being shelled by Russian forces every day. Bodies are piled at the morgue. But residents refuse to succumb.

header: European Leaders Brave Russian Bombardment in Visit to Kyiv.
desc: The prime ministers of Poland, the Czech Republic and Slovenia made the trip as a show of solidarity, but it also bared divisions with other European Union members.

text: European Leaders Brave Russian Bombardment in Visit to Kyiv. The prime ministers of Poland, the Czech Republic and Slovenia made the trip as a show of solidarity, but it also bared divisions with other European Union members.

header: Two Refugees, Both on Poland’s Border. But Worlds Apart.

text: Two Refugees, Both on Poland’s Border. But Worlds Apart. A young man fleeing war in Sudan and a young woman evacuating Ukraine crossed into Poland at the same time. They had very different experiences.

header: Impunity for War Crimes in Syria Casts a Grim Shadow Over Ukraine.
desc: Syria, with Russian support, used many of the brutal tactics now seen in Ukraine — and its dictator stayed in power. That conflict offers lessons for Russia’s leader, analysts say.
author: Ben Hubbard
text: Impunity for War Crimes in Syria Casts a Grim Shadow Over Ukraine. Syria, with Russian support, used many of the brutal tactics now seen in Ukraine — and its dictator stayed in power. That conflict offers lessons for Russia’s leader, analysts say.

header: A Chinese video blogger in Odessa challenges Beijing’s version of the war.
desc: Wang Jixian has become one of the boldest voices confronting the Chinese state-controlled media’s narrative, drawing hundreds of thousands of viewers.
author: Chris Buckley
text: A Chinese video blogger in Odessa challenges Beijing’s version of the war. Wang Jixian has become one of the boldest voices confronting the Chinese state-controlled media’s narrative, drawing hundreds of thousands of viewers.

header: The U.S. warns China not to give Russia military or economic aid.

text: The U.S. warns China not to give Russia military or economic aid. The Kremlin denied the report, and the spokesman for the Chinese Embassy in Washington said he had never heard of the request.

header: Kyiv’s Once-Busy Streets Empty as Russia Targets Capital.

author: Carlotta Gall
text: Kyiv’s Once-Busy Streets Empty as Russia Targets Capital. With civilian areas coming under fire and an estimated half the population having fled, the avenues of the Ukrainian capital, under siege by Russian forces, are almost deserted.

author: Jesus Jiménez
text: Zelensky calls on Russian troops to surrender. The Ukrainian leader and the Pentagon have both said some Russian soldiers have surrendered or been captured.

header: Ukrainian Forces Strike Back at Russia as Biden Sends More Firepower.

text: Ukrainian Forces Strike Back at Russia as Biden Sends More Firepower. The attacks in Kyiv and Kherson were aimed at inflicting “maximum losses” against Russia but not regaining territory, while the U.S. pledged $800 million more in military aid.

header: Why Vladimir Putin Invokes Nazis to Justify His Invasion of Ukraine.

text: Why Vladimir Putin Invokes Nazis to Justify His Invasion of Ukraine. The language of Russia’s invasion has been dominated by the word “Nazi” — a puzzling assertion about a country whose leader is Jewish.

author: Andrew E. Kramer, Michael Schwirtz and Eric Nagourney
text: Survivors Emerge From a Bombed Theater, but Ukraine’s Suffering Grows. Russia continues to devastate cities and hit civilians, as Ukrainian forces strike back and peace talks drag on.

header: UNESCO will send body armor to Ukrainian journalists.

author: Jane Arraf
text: UNESCO will send body armor to Ukrainian journalists. The U.N. agency said thousands of Ukrainian journalists with no protective equipment or training were now covering the war. At least four journalists have been killed.

header: An American who traveled to Ukraine for his partner’s treatment is killed.
author: Megan Specia and Michael Schwirtz
text: An American who traveled to Ukraine for his partner’s treatment is killed.

header: L.G.B.T.Q. activists in Ukraine share the fight against Russia’s invasion.

text: L.G.B.T.Q. activists in Ukraine share the fight against Russia’s invasion. A pro-Russian puppet government would be less supportive of gay rights, the activists say, and incidents of discrimination would be likely to rise, as they have in Russian-backed separatist regions.

header: Videos show a destroyed Mariupol theater that Ukrainian officials say sheltered hundreds of civilians.

text: Videos show a destroyed Mariupol theater that Ukrainian officials say sheltered hundreds of civilians.

header: A Fox News journalist who was injured in Ukraine is now ‘safe.’.

author: Michael M. Grynbaum
text: A Fox News journalist who was injured in Ukraine is now ‘safe.’. Benjamin Hall was seriously injured in an incident that killed a Fox News cameraman and a young Ukrainian journalist.

header: Putin’s War on Ukraine Is About Ethnicity and Empire.
desc: Biden’s framework of ‘democracies versus autocracies’ misses the darker source of this war, which has deep roots in Russian history and thought.
author: Steven Erlanger
text: Putin’s War on Ukraine Is About Ethnicity and Empire. Biden’s framework of ‘democracies versus autocracies’ misses the darker source of this war, which has deep roots in Russian history and thought.

header: Oligarchs Got Richer Despite Sanctions. Will This Time Be Different?.
desc: For nearly a decade, sanctions have been little more than names on a list for wealthy Russians. Governments are working to give them bite.
author: Matt Apuzzo and Jane Bradley
text: Oligarchs Got Richer Despite Sanctions. Will This Time Be Different?. For nearly a decade, sanctions have been little more than names on a list for wealthy Russians. Governments are working to give them bite.

header: Russia Targets Western Ukraine as Biden Warns Xi Not to Aid Moscow.
desc: A scramble of diplomatic efforts bears little fruit as Russia intensifies its attacks, including with a bombardment into a relatively unscathed part of western Ukraine.

text: Russia Targets Western Ukraine as Biden Warns Xi Not to Aid Moscow. A scramble of diplomatic efforts bears little fruit as Russia intensifies its attacks, including with a bombardment into a relatively unscathed part of western Ukraine.

header: Deadly Strike on Ukraine Barracks Punctuates Russian Military Gains.
desc: Ukraine said it had temporarily lost contact with officials in the strategic port city of Mariupol, and a Russian rocket attack on a military site in Mykolaiv left dozens dead.

text: Deadly Strike on Ukraine Barracks Punctuates Russian Military Gains. Ukraine said it had temporarily lost contact with officials in the strategic port city of Mariupol, and a Russian rocket attack on a military site in Mykolaiv left dozens dead.

header: Defying China’s Censors to Urge Beijing to Denounce Russia’s War.

author: Chris Buckley
text: Defying China’s Censors to Urge Beijing to Denounce Russia’s War. A persistent minority of Chinese scholars, journalists and citizens is warning Beijing against the risks of supporting the invasion of Ukraine.

header: Kyiv’s Suburbs Become Unlikely Front Line of Ukraine War.
desc: With savage artillery exchanges, the areas on the outskirts of the capital are the scenes of seesaw battles that have stalled the Russian advance for now.

text: Kyiv’s Suburbs Become Unlikely Front Line of Ukraine War. With savage artillery exchanges, the areas on the outskirts of the capital are the scenes of seesaw battles that have stalled the Russian advance for now.

header: Pope Deplores the War in Ukraine but Not the Aggressor.
desc: Francis has raised his voice against “unacceptable armed aggression” without mentioning President Vladimir V. Putin or Russia. Some analysts say that he risks complicating his legacy.
author: Jason Horowitz
text: Pope Deplores the War in Ukraine but Not the Aggressor. Francis has raised his voice against “unacceptable armed aggression” without mentioning President Vladimir V. Putin or Russia. Some analysts say that he risks complicating his legacy.

header: The battle for Kyiv could be the biggest urban battle in decades.

text: The battle for Kyiv could be the biggest urban battle in decades. “There’s no talk of capitulation for Kyiv,” said Lt. Tetiana Chornovol, the commander of an anti-tank missile unit on the outskirts of the city.

header: The Battle for Kyiv Looms as a Long and Bloody Conflict.
desc: Ukraine’s capital is the biggest prize of all for the Russian military. If Russia tries to take control, it could lead to one of the biggest urban conflicts since World War II.
author: NA
text: The Battle for Kyiv Looms as a Long and Bloody Conflict. Ukraine’s capital is the biggest prize of all for the Russian military. If Russia tries to take control, it could lead to one of the biggest urban conflicts since World War II.

header: Ukrainian tennis stars trade rackets for rifles in the fight for their country.
desc: Sergiy Stakhovsky, Andriy Medvedev and Alexandr Dolgopolov have gone to Kyiv to fight the invading Russian military.
author: Megan Specia
text: Ukrainian tennis stars trade rackets for rifles in the fight for their country. Sergiy Stakhovsky, Andriy Medvedev and Alexandr Dolgopolov have gone to Kyiv to fight the invading Russian military.

header: Ukraine’s celebrities are dying in the war, adding an extra dimension to the nation’s shock.
author: Matthew Mpoke Bigg and Ada Petriczko
text: Ukraine’s celebrities are dying in the war, adding an extra dimension to the nation’s shock.

header: As diplomacy drags on, peace seems far off in Ukraine.
desc: Western officials have little optimism that talks between Russia and Ukraine have reached a serious stage or have even confronted the most difficult issues.
author: Steven Erlanger and Patrick Kingsley
text: As diplomacy drags on, peace seems far off in Ukraine. Western officials have little optimism that talks between Russia and Ukraine have reached a serious stage or have even confronted the most difficult issues.

header: Russians Pound Ukrainian Cities, as Biden Rallies Anti-Kremlin Alliance.

text: Russians Pound Ukrainian Cities, as Biden Rallies Anti-Kremlin Alliance. A powerful explosion ruined a shopping mall in Kyiv and claimed several lives, while Ukraine refused a Russian demand to surrender the devastated city of Mariupol.

header: Russia Broadens Mariupol Assault as Signs of Stalemate Take Shape.
desc: The battle for Mariupol has become a grim symbol of Russia’s superior firepower and its frustration in failing to subjugate Ukraine after more than three weeks of war.

text: Russia Broadens Mariupol Assault as Signs of Stalemate Take Shape. The battle for Mariupol has become a grim symbol of Russia’s superior firepower and its frustration in failing to subjugate Ukraine after more than three weeks of war.

header: Ukraine War Threatens to Cause a Global Food Crisis.

author: Jack Nicas
text: Ukraine War Threatens to Cause a Global Food Crisis. A critical share of the world’s food and fertilizer is stuck in Russia and Ukraine, sending global prices soaring and foreshadowing a rise in world hunger.

header: Truth Is Another Front in Putin’s War.

header: As Mariupol Is Bombed and Besieged, Those Trapped Fight to Survive.

text: As Mariupol Is Bombed and Besieged, Those Trapped Fight to Survive. For three weeks, the Ukrainian port city has been without water, heat, electricity and all communication under a merciless Russian assault. Here’s what its residents have been enduring.

text: An Ancient City Transformed by War. Simple rituals, like having coffee in a cafe in Lviv, Ukraine, take on a new and sometimes surreal meaning in a radically altered context.

header: ‘I Don’t Have the Right to Cry’: Ukrainian Women Share Their Stories of Escape.

author: Zolan Kanno-Youngs
text: Biden warns the private sector that Russia is exploring options for cyberattacks. The president cited “evolving intelligence” and urged companies to strengthen their defenses immediately.

header: Ukrainians Try to Push Back Russian Forces Pummeling Their Cities.

header: Civilians Flee Eastern Ukraine as Signs Point to Stepped-Up Russian Attack.
desc: Alarmed by reports of atrocities near Kyiv, many residents of Ukraine’s east, now suffering the brunt of Russian force, are getting out while they can.
author: Megan Specia, Cora Engelbrecht and Eric Schmitt
text: Civilians Flee Eastern Ukraine as Signs Point to Stepped-Up Russian Attack. Alarmed by reports of atrocities near Kyiv, many residents of Ukraine’s east, now suffering the brunt of Russian force, are getting out while they can.

header: More Russians Consider Costs of War in Ukraine as Casualties Mount.
desc: Many Russians have been in the dark about their country’s losses. As news of more Russian deaths arrives, the reactions range from anger at the Kremlin to parroting the state’s messaging that blames “Nazis’’ in Ukraine.
author: Anton Troianovski, Ivan Nechepurenko and Valeriya Safronova
text: More Russians Consider Costs of War in Ukraine as Casualties Mount. Many Russians have been in the dark about their country’s losses. As news of more Russian deaths arrives, the reactions range from anger at the Kremlin to parroting the state’s messaging that blames “Nazis’’ in Ukraine.

header: Traces of Lives Cut Short: Bread on a Park Bench, Blood Pooled Nearby.
desc: The violence of war is often random. Those who suffer most are the civilians caught in the middle. Two recent deaths in Kharkiv, Ukraine, are a testament to that.
author: Thomas Gibbons-Neff and Natalia Yermak
text: Traces of Lives Cut Short: Bread on a Park Bench, Blood Pooled Nearby. The violence of war is often random. Those who suffer most are the civilians caught in the middle. Two recent deaths in Kharkiv, Ukraine, are a testament to that.

header: Zelensky Accuses Russia of Atrocities and Criticizes U.N.’s Inaction.
desc: In a blistering address to the United Nations Security Council, Ukraine’s president asked what use the body was if it would not intervene to stop a war of aggression.
author: Richard Pérez-Pena
text: Zelensky Accuses Russia of Atrocities and Criticizes U.N.’s Inaction. In a blistering address to the United Nations Security Council, Ukraine’s president asked what use the body was if it would not intervene to stop a war of aggression.

header: The End of the (Pipe)line? Germany Scrambles to Wean Itself Off Russian Gas.
desc: Dangerously dependent on Russian gas, Germany is still refusing to cut off President Putin, whose war it is effectively subsidizing to the tune of some $220 million a day.
author: Katrin Bennhold
text: The End of the (Pipe)line? Germany Scrambles to Wean Itself Off Russian Gas. Dangerously dependent on Russian gas, Germany is still refusing to cut off President Putin, whose war it is effectively subsidizing to the tune of some $220 million a day.

header: Some Ukrainian Refugees Are Returning Home, Despite the Risks.
desc: A growing number of families, convinced the war could last for years, have decided that facing danger at home is better than life as a refugee.
author: Jane Arraf
text: Some Ukrainian Refugees Are Returning Home, Despite the Risks. A growing number of families, convinced the war could last for years, have decided that facing danger at home is better than life as a refugee.

header: In South Korea, Ukraine War Revives the Nuclear Question.
desc: Seoul abandoned a covert program in the 1970s, but some argue it is time for the country to embrace its nuclear ambitions and safeguard against a Russia-style invasion.
author: Choe Sang-Hun
text: In South Korea, Ukraine War Revives the Nuclear Question. Seoul abandoned a covert program in the 1970s, but some argue it is time for the country to embrace its nuclear ambitions and safeguard against a Russia-style invasion.

header: Why Tracking Putin’s Wealth Is So Difficult.
desc: Amid speculation that oligarchs are holding cash and luxury assets for the Russian president, many of his extravagances can be traced elsewhere: the Russian state.
author: Mike McIntire
text: Why Tracking Putin’s Wealth Is So Difficult. Amid speculation that oligarchs are holding cash and luxury assets for the Russian president, many of his extravagances can be traced elsewhere: the Russian state.

header: Countries have expelled 120 Russian spies since the war in Ukraine started.
desc: Despite the purge of intelligence officers, former officials cautioned that Moscow would have other ways to collect information and that the efforts would have little impact on the war in Ukraine.
author: Julian E. Barnes
text: Countries have expelled 120 Russian spies since the war in Ukraine started. Despite the purge of intelligence officers, former officials cautioned that Moscow would have other ways to collect information and that the efforts would have little impact on the war in Ukraine.

header: ‘He Is a Child of War’: Giving Birth Amid Chaos in Ukraine.
desc: As artillery shells fall, pregnant women are delivering prematurely, being shuttled in and out of bomb shelters or having babies in basements without even a midwife to help. Tens of thousands more are displaced.
author: NA
text: ‘He Is a Child of War’: Giving Birth Amid Chaos in Ukraine. As artillery shells fall, pregnant women are delivering prematurely, being shuttled in and out of bomb shelters or having babies in basements without even a midwife to help. Tens of thousands more are displaced.

header: Missile Strike in Eastern Ukraine Kills 50 Awaiting Train to Escape.
desc: Ukraine’s president blamed Russia for the latest atrocity in the six-week-old war, calling the Russian invasion force “an evil that has no limits.” Moscow denied responsibility.
author: Megan Specia and Michael Levenson
text: Missile Strike in Eastern Ukraine Kills 50 Awaiting Train to Escape. Ukraine’s president blamed Russia for the latest atrocity in the six-week-old war, calling the Russian invasion force “an evil that has no limits.” Moscow denied responsibility.

header: Land Mines on a Timer, Scattered Over a Ukrainian Town.
desc: Civilians near Kharkiv in northeastern Ukraine are discovering a new threat: munitions that eject up to two dozen small mines that explode at intervals.
author: Thomas Gibbons-Neff and John Ismay
text: Land Mines on a Timer, Scattered Over a Ukrainian Town. Civilians near Kharkiv in northeastern Ukraine are discovering a new threat: munitions that eject up to two dozen small mines that explode at intervals.

header: Russian Blunders in Chernobyl: ‘They Came and Did Whatever They Wanted’.
desc: Tank treads ripped up the toxic soil, bulldozers carved trenches and bunkers, and soldiers spent a month camped in — and dug into — a radioactive forest.
author: Andrew E. Kramer and Ivor Prickett
text: Russian Blunders in Chernobyl: ‘They Came and Did Whatever They Wanted’. Tank treads ripped up the toxic soil, bulldozers carved trenches and bunkers, and soldiers spent a month camped in — and dug into — a radioactive forest.

header: West Moves to Curb Russian Coal and Trade Over Ukraine War.
desc: The United Nations also penalized Russia, suspending it from the Human Rights Council, as Russian forces moved to assault eastern Ukraine and more evidence emerged implicating them in atrocities against civilians.
author: Matina Stevis-Gridneff, Michael Levenson and Steven Erlanger
text: West Moves to Curb Russian Coal and Trade Over Ukraine War. The United Nations also penalized Russia, suspending it from the Human Rights Council, as Russian forces moved to assault eastern Ukraine and more evidence emerged implicating them in atrocities against civilians.

header: In Ukraine, Sudden Death on a Train Platform.
desc: A railway station in eastern Ukraine had been a main departure point for people seeking to escape an expected Russian onslaught. A rocket assault left at least 50 dead.
author: Megan Specia
text: In Ukraine, Sudden Death on a Train Platform. A railway station in eastern Ukraine had been a main departure point for people seeking to escape an expected Russian onslaught. A rocket assault left at least 50 dead.

header: Pink Floyd says it will release its first new track in decades to support Ukraine.
desc: The song, “Hey Hey Rise Up,” is a reworking of a protest song from World War I and features the Ukrainian rock star Andriy Khlyvnyuk of the band Boombox.
author: Anushka Patil
text: Pink Floyd says it will release its first new track in decades to support Ukraine. The song, “Hey Hey Rise Up,” is a reworking of a protest song from World War I and features the Ukrainian rock star Andriy Khlyvnyuk of the band Boombox.

header: A Russian attack hits a train station in Ukraine’s east where crowds had been evacuating.
desc: The strike in Kramatorsk, which had been a main point of evacuation for thousands of people trying to flee eastern Ukraine, left “dozens” dead and injured, according to a local official.
author: Megan Specia
text: A Russian attack hits a train station in Ukraine’s east where crowds had been evacuating. The strike in Kramatorsk, which had been a main point of evacuation for thousands of people trying to flee eastern Ukraine, left “dozens” dead and injured, according to a local official.

header: For Ukrainian Writer, War Evokes Scars of Time in Captivity.
desc: Stanislav Aseyev, a 32-year-old journalist, had documented his abuse in a prison run by Russian-backed separatists. Now, the war reminds him of why Ukrainians are fighting for their lives.
author: Valerie Hopkins
text: For Ukrainian Writer, War Evokes Scars of Time in Captivity. Stanislav Aseyev, a 32-year-old journalist, had documented his abuse in a prison run by Russian-backed separatists. Now, the war reminds him of why Ukrainians are fighting for their lives.

header: Ukraine’s Eurovision entry goes on tour to help fund the war effort.
desc: Kalush Orchestra, a group that mixes rap and traditional Ukrainian music, was given special permission to leave the country and play internationally.
author: Victoria Kim
text: Ukraine’s Eurovision entry goes on tour to help fund the war effort. Kalush Orchestra, a group that mixes rap and traditional Ukrainian music, was given special permission to leave the country and play internationally.

header: Racing for safety, Ukrainians meet new perils.
desc: With Russian troops massing for a presumed new assault in the east, many civilians heeded warnings and headed west. Some did not make it.
author: Cora Engelbrecht, David Zucchino and Jane Arraf
text: Racing for safety, Ukrainians meet new perils. With Russian troops massing for a presumed new assault in the east, many civilians heeded warnings and headed west. Some did not make it.

header: Russia Shuffles Command in Ukraine as Thousands Flee the East.
desc: The Russian campaign will be consolidated under a veteran of the Syrian war, while Western nations pump additional arms into Ukraine.
author: Eric Schmitt, Jane Arraf and Michael Levenson
text: Russia Shuffles Command in Ukraine as Thousands Flee the East. The Russian campaign will be consolidated under a veteran of the Syrian war, while Western nations pump additional arms into Ukraine.

header: A Stricken Ukrainian City Empties, and Those Left Fear What’s Next.
desc: After the deadly strike on the train station in Kramatorsk, Ukraine, those who stayed behind are grim about the future: “We think we will be swept off the face of the earth.”
author: NA
text: A Stricken Ukrainian City Empties, and Those Left Fear What’s Next. After the deadly strike on the train station in Kramatorsk, Ukraine, those who stayed behind are grim about the future: “We think we will be swept off the face of the earth.”

header: Why Calls for War Crimes Justice Over Ukraine Face Long Odds.
desc: If those in power act as if they are immune to the laws of war, it may be because they often are. But following through is not necessarily an empty exercise.
author: Max Fisher
text: Why Calls for War Crimes Justice Over Ukraine Face Long Odds. If those in power act as if they are immune to the laws of war, it may be because they often are. But following through is not necessarily an empty exercise.

header: Spurred by Putin, Russians Turn on One Another Over the War.
desc: Citizens are denouncing one another, illustrating how the war is feeding paranoia and polarization in Russian society.
author: Anton Troianovski
text: Spurred by Putin, Russians Turn on One Another Over the War. Citizens are denouncing one another, illustrating how the war is feeding paranoia and polarization in Russian society.

header: ‘Everything Was Destroyed’: War Hits Ukraine’s Farms.
desc: The Russian invasion is pummeling Ukraine’s agriculture, threatening harvests in Europe’s breadbasket and contributing to a global food crisis.
author: Emma Bubola, Valeriya Safronova and Maria Varenikova
text: ‘Everything Was Destroyed’: War Hits Ukraine’s Farms. The Russian invasion is pummeling Ukraine’s agriculture, threatening harvests in Europe’s breadbasket and contributing to a global food crisis.

header: Israel’s Ukraine Policy Prompts Scrutiny of Russian-Israeli Oligarchs.
desc: Israel has expressed solidarity with Ukraine but avoided direct criticism of Russia, raising questions about Russian-Israeli businessmen close to the Kremlin.
author: Patrick Kingsley
text: Israel’s Ukraine Policy Prompts Scrutiny of Russian-Israeli Oligarchs. Israel has expressed solidarity with Ukraine but avoided direct criticism of Russia, raising questions about Russian-Israeli businessmen close to the Kremlin.

header: Ukraine’s Draft Dodgers Face Guilt, Shame and Reproach.
desc: Thousands of Ukrainian men are avoiding military service, putting them on risky paths into Europe. Among Ukrainians, it’s stirring a complicated debate.
author: Jeffrey Gettleman and Monika Pronczuk
text: Ukraine’s Draft Dodgers Face Guilt, Shame and Reproach. Thousands of Ukrainian men are avoiding military service, putting them on risky paths into Europe. Among Ukrainians, it’s stirring a complicated debate.

header: Japan dials up measures against Russia, aligning itself with the U.S. and Europe.
desc: The country has announced a ban on Russian coal and restrictions on imports including timber, vodka and machinery. It is also expelling eight Russian diplomats.
author: Victoria Kim
text: Japan dials up measures against Russia, aligning itself with the U.S. and Europe. The country has announced a ban on Russian coal and restrictions on imports including timber, vodka and machinery. It is also expelling eight Russian diplomats.

header: An 85-year-old mother recalls a desperate struggle to save her daughter in eastern Ukraine.
desc: Lidiia, 85, fought through a night to free her disabled daughter from rubble after a Russian strike hit their house. She didn’t have the strength.
author: Jane Arraf
text: An 85-year-old mother recalls a desperate struggle to save her daughter in eastern Ukraine. Lidiia, 85, fought through a night to free her disabled daughter from rubble after a Russian strike hit their house. She didn’t have the strength.

header: Putin Calls Talks a ‘Dead End’ but Limits War Aim to Eastern Ukraine.
desc: It was the first time that President Vladimir Putin himself had defined a more limited military goal: taking control of the Donbas region in the east of Ukraine — not the whole country.
author: Anton Troianovski
text: Putin Calls Talks a ‘Dead End’ but Limits War Aim to Eastern Ukraine. It was the first time that President Vladimir Putin himself had defined a more limited military goal: taking control of the Donbas region in the east of Ukraine — not the whole country.

header: Far From Defeated, Putin Intends to Escalate War in Ukraine.
desc: Austria’s chancellor said after meeting with Mr. Putin that the Russian president had “totally adopted the logic of war.”
author: Steven Erlanger and Anton Troianovski
text: Far From Defeated, Putin Intends to Escalate War in Ukraine. Austria’s chancellor said after meeting with Mr. Putin that the Russian president had “totally adopted the logic of war.”

header: No More ‘Have a Nice Day’: Lviv Learns to Live With War.
desc: Ukraine’s cultural capital, the western city of Lviv, is trying to adjust to being on the fringes of war and at the center of massive displacement.

text: No More ‘Have a Nice Day’: Lviv Learns to Live With War. Ukraine’s cultural capital, the western city of Lviv, is trying to adjust to being on the fringes of war and at the center of massive displacement.

header: With India on the fence over Ukraine, Biden meets with Modi.
desc: India, heavily dependent on Russian weapons, has long tried not to take sides between Moscow and Washington. It has refrained from denouncing Russia’s invasion or imposing sanctions.
author: Mujib Mashal
text: With India on the fence over Ukraine, Biden meets with Modi. India, heavily dependent on Russian weapons, has long tried not to take sides between Moscow and Washington. It has refrained from denouncing Russia’s invasion or imposing sanctions.

header: Ukraine War Pushes Germans to Change. They Are Wavering.
desc: In just six weeks since Chancellor Olaf Scholz announced a strategic shift for his country, already doubts are emerging about how real and deep it is.
author: Katrin Bennhold and Steven Erlanger
text: Ukraine War Pushes Germans to Change. They Are Wavering. In just six weeks since Chancellor Olaf Scholz announced a strategic shift for his country, already doubts are emerging about how real and deep it is.

header: Zelensky says Ukraine takes ‘as seriously as possible’ an apparent threat of Russian chemical weapon use.
desc: A Ukrainian unit in Mariupol claimed Russian forces had used chemical weapons there. Their report could not be independently confirmed.
author: Jesus Jiménez
text: Zelensky says Ukraine takes ‘as seriously as possible’ an apparent threat of Russian chemical weapon use. A Ukrainian unit in Mariupol claimed Russian forces had used chemical weapons there. Their report could not be independently confirmed.

header: The U.N. Security Council focuses on the war’s toll on Ukraine’s women and children.
author: Farnaz Fassihi
text: The U.N. Security Council focuses on the war’s toll on Ukraine’s women and children.

header: Western powers look into an unverified claim of possible use of a chemical agent in Mariupol.

author: Marc Santora, Megan Specia and Rick Gladstone
text: Western powers look into an unverified claim of possible use of a chemical agent in Mariupol. Ukrainian commanders said “a poisonous substance” caused respiratory difficulties and neurological symptoms in a handful of soldiers and civilians.

header: Ukraine says a political ally of Putin has been detained in a ‘special operation.’.
desc: Viktor Medvedchuk, a wealthy Ukrainian politician seen as the Kremlin’s main agent of influence in Ukraine in recent years, had disappeared shortly after the start of the war.
author: Carlotta Gall and Anton Troianovski
text: Ukraine says a political ally of Putin has been detained in a ‘special operation.’. Viktor Medvedchuk, a wealthy Ukrainian politician seen as the Kremlin’s main agent of influence in Ukraine in recent years, had disappeared shortly after the start of the war.

header: Hiding in Plain Sight, a Soviet-Era Air Defense System Arrives in Ukraine.
desc: Encouraged by the United States, Slovakia “donated” a bulky but effective S-300, hoping to challenge Russian domination of the skies in the war next door.

author: Steven Erlanger and Johanna Lemola

header: The Ukrainian Refugee Crisis Is a Women’s Crisis.

author: Amanda Taub
text: The Ukrainian Refugee Crisis Is a Women’s Crisis. A wave of displaced women and children into Poland is forcing the country to address its lack of protections for working women.

desc: Ukraine claimed it was the same vessel that was famously and obscenely told off by Ukrainian troops in February.
author: Anushka Patil and Alan Yuhas
text: A Russian warship is ‘seriously damaged’ in the Black Sea. Conflicting explanations emerge. Ukraine claimed it was the same vessel that was famously and obscenely told off by Ukrainian troops in February.

header: On Poland-Ukraine Border, the Past Is Always Present. It’s Not Always Predictive.
desc: For a Jewish reporter with Eastern European roots, one of the hardest challenges covering the war is reconciling the horrors of the Holocaust with the Poland and Ukraine of today.
author: Jeffrey Gettleman
text: On Poland-Ukraine Border, the Past Is Always Present. It’s Not Always Predictive. For a Jewish reporter with Eastern European roots, one of the hardest challenges covering the war is reconciling the horrors of the Holocaust with the Poland and Ukraine of today.
