desc: No American official has publicly visited Ukraine since Russia launched its invasion in late February.
author: Michael D. Shear
text: The U.S. is considering sending a high-level official to Kyiv. No American official has publicly visited Ukraine since Russia launched its invasion in late February.

header: Pencil Cases and Air-Raid Sirens: School at War for Ukraine’s Children.

author: Megan Specia and Maria Varenikova
text: Pencil Cases and Air-Raid Sirens: School at War for Ukraine’s Children. The country’s teachers are doing their best to provide lessons for the millions of school-age children whose education has been interrupted.

header: Tensions Over the Ukraine War Deepen the Chill Near the North Pole.

text: Tensions Over the Ukraine War Deepen the Chill Near the North Pole. The war and the comments of a Russian diplomat have strained relations on an archipelago in Norway where Russians, Ukrainians and Norwegians have lived peacefully for decades.

text: Russia Fires Missile Barrage at Ukrainian Cities and Military Targets. The strikes seemed aimed at hampering Ukraine’s war fighting capacity as the conflict shifts to eastern Donbas region, and at responding to the sinking of a Russian warship.

header: Girding for New Battle, Russia Warns U.S. on Advanced Weapons for Ukraine.

text: Girding for New Battle, Russia Warns U.S. on Advanced Weapons for Ukraine. The warnings were regarded as a sign that American military assistance to Ukraine was compounding problems for the Russians in their two-month-old invasion.

header: Putin’s Ukraine Gamble Pivots to a Very Different Battlefield.

text: Putin’s Ukraine Gamble Pivots to a Very Different Battlefield. After Russian forces were mauled in cities and towns in northern Ukraine, Vladimir V. Putin is shifting the focus of his invasion to the flatlands of Donbas, in the east.

author: Jeffrey Gettleman, Oleksandr Chubko and David Guttenfelder
text: ‘Thank You for Not Killing Us’. An ordeal at a mental health facility in Ukraine illuminated the horrors of the Russian occupation in the areas around Kyiv.

header: The Moskva’s sinking inspires one of Ukraine’s most popular rockers.

author: Jane Arraf
text: The Moskva’s sinking inspires one of Ukraine’s most popular rockers. Vadym Krasnooky, whose band Mad Heads had stopped performing when the war began, said his new song is meant to ‘channel all this hate.’

text: Russia’s Black Sea flagship was hit by 2 Ukrainian missiles, a U.S. official says. Moscow claimed the sinking was an accident, but U.S. intelligence reports say the cruiser went down after Ukraine struck it with Neptune missiles.

header: Where Russians Turn for Uncensored News on Ukraine.

text: Where Russians Turn for Uncensored News on Ukraine. Telegram is the platform of choice for Russians seeking to escape Moscow’s propaganda web. But can it last?

header: Ukraine Says Russia Begins Assault in the East After Raining Missiles Nationwide.

The president of Ukraine and a top national security aide said the Russian offensive, anticipated for weeks, had finally begun after a Russian missile barrage that included the first deadly strike on the western city of Lviv.

text: What is the Neptune, the Ukrainian-made missile that sank Russia’s warship?. The missile is part of a coastal defense system designed to hide below enemy radar and evade counterattacks.

header: A Russian strike hits Lviv, a city relatively untouched by violence.
desc: Hundreds of thousands of displaced people from other parts of Ukraine have fled to, or through, Lviv to escape the fighting. Then it landed on their doorstep.
author: Jane Arraf
text: A Russian strike hits Lviv, a city relatively untouched by violence. Hundreds of thousands of displaced people from other parts of Ukraine have fled to, or through, Lviv to escape the fighting. Then it landed on their doorstep.

header: The U.S. Races to Arm Ukraine With Heavier, More Advanced Weaponry.
desc: Washington and its allies are scouring Central Europe and the world to get Ukraine the weapons it needs for the next phase of the war.
author: Steven Erlanger, Eric Schmitt and Julian E. Barnes
text: The U.S. Races to Arm Ukraine With Heavier, More Advanced Weaponry. Washington and its allies are scouring Central Europe and the world to get Ukraine the weapons it needs for the next phase of the war.

header: More Cautious, Russia Embarks on New Phase of Ukraine War.
desc: Despite the Kremlin’s new methodical approach focusing on eastern Ukraine, the Russian military still faces some of the same problems that hampered it after the war began.
author: Thomas Gibbons-Neff, Michael Schwirtz and Eric Schmitt
text: More Cautious, Russia Embarks on New Phase of Ukraine War. Despite the Kremlin’s new methodical approach focusing on eastern Ukraine, the Russian military still faces some of the same problems that hampered it after the war began.

header: A Ukrainian Town Goes Underground as Russia Assaults the East.
desc: As Ukrainian forces dig into trenches and residents flee into basements, Russia’s artillery attacks have intensified. “They can’t get through the front lines and so they’re starting simply to destroy the city,” a Ukrainian official said.
author: Michael Schwirtz
text: A Ukrainian Town Goes Underground as Russia Assaults the East. As Ukrainian forces dig into trenches and residents flee into basements, Russia’s artillery attacks have intensified. “They can’t get through the front lines and so they’re starting simply to destroy the city,” a Ukrainian official said.

header: Warning Ukraine’s Friends to ‘Think Twice,’ Putin Tests Advanced Missile.
desc: Vladimir Putin said Russia’s test-firing of its new I.C.B.M. sends a message, as his forces prepare for a broad offensive in eastern Ukraine.
author: Anton Troianovski and Richard Pérez-Pena
text: Warning Ukraine’s Friends to ‘Think Twice,’ Putin Tests Advanced Missile. Vladimir Putin said Russia’s test-firing of its new I.C.B.M. sends a message, as his forces prepare for a broad offensive in eastern Ukraine.

header: Despair in Mariupol’s last stronghold: ‘They’re bombing us with everything’.
desc: A huge Soviet-era steel mill is where the last Ukrainian defenders of Mariupol have taken refuge as Russia’s battle to take full control of the city appeared to be entering its final stages.
author: Michael Schwirtz, Cora Engelbrecht and Andrew E. Kramer
text: Despair in Mariupol’s last stronghold: ‘They’re bombing us with everything’. A huge Soviet-era steel mill is where the last Ukrainian defenders of Mariupol have taken refuge as Russia’s battle to take full control of the city appeared to be entering its final stages.

header: He Was a Penniless Donor to the Far Right. He Was Also a Russian Spy.
desc: An investigation in Slovakia has exposed how Russian clandestine operations are trying to sow discord in Europe and create sympathy for Moscow over Ukraine.
author: Andrew Higgins
text: He Was a Penniless Donor to the Far Right. He Was Also a Russian Spy. An investigation in Slovakia has exposed how Russian clandestine operations are trying to sow discord in Europe and create sympathy for Moscow over Ukraine.

header: The U.S. is bolstering Ukrainian artillery and air power.
desc: Weeklong training for Ukraine’s soldiers on howitzers is taking place outside of their country, a U.S. defense official said. Additionally, new spare parts have allowed Kyiv to get more than 20 warplanes back in service.
author: John Ismay
text: The U.S. is bolstering Ukrainian artillery and air power. Weeklong training for Ukraine’s soldiers on howitzers is taking place outside of their country, a U.S. defense official said. Additionally, new spare parts have allowed Kyiv to get more than 20 warplanes back in service.

header: Ukraine’s War Efforts Gain an Unlikely Source of Funding: Memes.

author: Jane Arraf
text: Ukraine’s War Efforts Gain an Unlikely Source of Funding: Memes. A campaign using internet memes and merchandise has rallied international public support for Ukraine in its war with Russia.

header: Ukraine’s profane stamp that has become a symbol of resistance sells out.
author: Jane Arraf
text: Ukraine’s profane stamp that has become a symbol of resistance sells out.

header: Calls to Give Heavy Weapons to Ukraine Divide Germany’s Government.
desc: Weeks after Chancellor Olaf Scholz announced a paradigm shift in military strategy, his government is struggling to balance domestic politics, how to help Ukraine and anxiety over provoking Russia.
author: Erika Solomon
text: Calls to Give Heavy Weapons to Ukraine Divide Germany’s Government. Weeks after Chancellor Olaf Scholz announced a paradigm shift in military strategy, his government is struggling to balance domestic politics, how to help Ukraine and anxiety over provoking Russia.

header: Russians Seize 42 Towns in Eastern Ukraine as Fighting Intensifies.
desc: Ukrainian military officials vowed to reverse Russia’s territorial gains in what was turning into a grinding back-and-forth struggle along a front stretching more than 300 miles.

text: Russians Seize 42 Towns in Eastern Ukraine as Fighting Intensifies. Ukrainian military officials vowed to reverse Russia’s territorial gains in what was turning into a grinding back-and-forth struggle along a front stretching more than 300 miles.

header: Calling Off Steel Plant Assault, Putin Prematurely Claims Victory in Mariupol.

text: Calling Off Steel Plant Assault, Putin Prematurely Claims Victory in Mariupol. With casualties mounting and progress slow in his war on Ukraine, Vladimir V. Putin is eager to present it to the Russian people as a success.

header: Ukraine needs up to $7 billion in support per month, Zelensky says.
desc: Ukraine has suffered $550 billion in losses from the war, President Volodymyr Zelensky told the World Bank on Thursday.
author: Jesus Jiménez
text: Ukraine needs up to $7 billion in support per month, Zelensky says. Ukraine has suffered $550 billion in losses from the war, President Volodymyr Zelensky told the World Bank on Thursday.

header: With sunken warship, Russian disinformation faces a test.

author: Neil MacFarquhar and Alina Lobzina
text: With sunken warship, Russian disinformation faces a test. Families of missing crew members say the Russian authorities are giving them the runaround after a flagship sank last week in the Black Sea.

header: Dug in on the front lines, Ukrainian soldiers fight to repel the Russian onslaught.
desc: After near-annihilation, and a marriage proposal, a Ukrainian unit has become a group of hardened veterans, dug in and determined.
author: Michael Schwirtz
text: Dug in on the front lines, Ukrainian soldiers fight to repel the Russian onslaught. After near-annihilation, and a marriage proposal, a Ukrainian unit has become a group of hardened veterans, dug in and determined.

header: Pope Francis condemns the war in Ukraine (again), but doesn’t name Putin (again).
desc: In a wide-ranging interview with an Argentine newspaper, Francis defended his decision not to call out Mr. Putin, but said he was ready to do “everything” to prevent more deaths.
author: Elisabetta Povoledo
text: Pope Francis condemns the war in Ukraine (again), but doesn’t name Putin (again). In a wide-ranging interview with an Argentine newspaper, Francis defended his decision not to call out Mr. Putin, but said he was ready to do “everything” to prevent more deaths.

header: One Ukrainian War Casualty: The World’s Largest Airplane.
desc: Mriya, the world’s largest aircraft, was destroyed in a pivotal battle at the start of the war. It was a beloved symbol for all of Ukraine but perhaps no one misses it more than its first pilot.
author: Jeffrey Gettleman
text: One Ukrainian War Casualty: The World’s Largest Airplane. Mriya, the world’s largest aircraft, was destroyed in a pivotal battle at the start of the war. It was a beloved symbol for all of Ukraine but perhaps no one misses it more than its first pilot.

header: People who escaped from Mariupol describe the flight from its ruins: ‘The city is gone.’.
desc: After a harrowing, all-night drive through Russian-controlled territory, evacuees said most of the city was pulverized by weeks of Russian shelling.
author: Michael Schwirtz
text: People who escaped from Mariupol describe the flight from its ruins: ‘The city is gone.’. After a harrowing, all-night drive through Russian-controlled territory, evacuees said most of the city was pulverized by weeks of Russian shelling.

header: Satellite images show what appears to be a growing mass grave near Mariupol.
author: Cora Engelbrecht and Christiaan Triebert
text: Satellite images show what appears to be a growing mass grave near Mariupol.

header: Biden announces $800 million in new military aid and questions Russia’s hold of Mariupol.
desc: President Biden said President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia would “never succeed in dominating” Ukraine.
author: David E. Sanger
text: Biden announces $800 million in new military aid and questions Russia’s hold of Mariupol. President Biden said President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia would “never succeed in dominating” Ukraine.

header: As Western Arms Pour Into Ukraine, Zelensky Promises Victory.
desc: “The day when they will be forced to leave Ukraine is approaching,” the Ukrainian president said of the Russians, in a sharp change of tone.
author: Marc Santora, Michael Schwirtz and Michael Levenson
text: As Western Arms Pour Into Ukraine, Zelensky Promises Victory. “The day when they will be forced to leave Ukraine is approaching,” the Ukrainian president said of the Russians, in a sharp change of tone.

header: U.S. Officials Make Top-Secret Visit to Ukraine.
desc: The American government refused to comment on reports that Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken and Defense Secretary Lloyd J. Austin III had traveled to Ukraine to meet with its leaders.
author: Andrew E. Kramer and Natalie Kitroeff
text: U.S. Officials Make Top-Secret Visit to Ukraine. The American government refused to comment on reports that Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken and Defense Secretary Lloyd J. Austin III had traveled to Ukraine to meet with its leaders.

header: Rattled by Ukraine War, Moldova Strives to Dodge Russia’s Long Shadow.
desc: Moldova’s destiny has been intertwined uncomfortably with Russia’s for years, and the Ukraine invasion has accelerated its efforts to break free from Moscow.
author: Monika Pronczuk and Jeffrey Gettleman
text: Rattled by Ukraine War, Moldova Strives to Dodge Russia’s Long Shadow. Moldova’s destiny has been intertwined uncomfortably with Russia’s for years, and the Ukraine invasion has accelerated its efforts to break free from Moscow.

header: In a Ukrainian School, 12 People Await the War’s End, or Their Own.
desc: In the basement of a battered school in Kharkiv, a dozen residents have taken shelter. In a neighborhood not far away, life has returned to some sense of normalcy. But they choose to stay.
author: NA
text: In a Ukrainian School, 12 People Await the War’s End, or Their Own. In the basement of a battered school in Kharkiv, a dozen residents have taken shelter. In a neighborhood not far away, life has returned to some sense of normalcy. But they choose to stay.

header: With Us or With Them? In a New Cold War, How About Neither.
desc: Old geopolitical foes are facing off after Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, but much of the world is refusing to take sides.

text: With Us or With Them? In a New Cold War, How About Neither. Old geopolitical foes are facing off after Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, but much of the world is refusing to take sides.

header: Blinken and Austin meet in Kyiv with Zelensky.
desc: Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken and Defense Secretary Lloyd J. Austin III met Sunday with President Volodymyr Zelensky, the first senior U.S. officials known to have visited Ukraine since the invasion.
author: Eduardo Medina and Michael Crowley
text: Blinken and Austin meet in Kyiv with Zelensky. Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken and Defense Secretary Lloyd J. Austin III met Sunday with President Volodymyr Zelensky, the first senior U.S. officials known to have visited Ukraine since the invasion.

header: Biden nominates an ambassador in Kyiv, aiming to fill a void in the U.S.-Ukraine relationship.
desc: President Biden nominated Bridget Brink, the current U.S. ambassador to Slovakia, as ambassador to Ukraine. The position has been empty for more than a year.
author: Anushka Patil and Edward Wong
text: Biden nominates an ambassador in Kyiv, aiming to fill a void in the U.S.-Ukraine relationship. President Biden nominated Bridget Brink, the current U.S. ambassador to Slovakia, as ambassador to Ukraine. The position has been empty for more than a year.

header: Ukrainians in Mariupol’s steel mill are holding on, despite intensifying attacks, a commander tells The Times.
desc: Capt. Svyatoslav Palamar says he and others would give up the factory if they could leave safely.
author: Michael Schwirtz
text: Ukrainians in Mariupol’s steel mill are holding on, despite intensifying attacks, a commander tells The Times. Capt. Svyatoslav Palamar says he and others would give up the factory if they could leave safely.

header: The Former Chancellor Who Became Putin’s Man in Germany.
desc: Gerhard Schröder, who is paid almost $1 million a year by Russian-controlled energy companies, has become a pariah. But he is also a symbol of Germany’s Russia policy.
author: Katrin Bennhold
text: The Former Chancellor Who Became Putin’s Man in Germany. Gerhard Schröder, who is paid almost $1 million a year by Russian-controlled energy companies, has become a pariah. But he is also a symbol of Germany’s Russia policy.

header: Ukrainians lean on Easter traditions in the shadow of a devastating war.
desc: In Lviv, residents had laid bouquets of flowers at the feet of a statue of the Virgin Mary, next to piles of white sandbags protecting the statue from bombings.

text: Ukrainians lean on Easter traditions in the shadow of a devastating war. In Lviv, residents had laid bouquets of flowers at the feet of a statue of the Virgin Mary, next to piles of white sandbags protecting the statue from bombings.

header: As Diplomacy Hopes Dim, U.S. Marshals Allies to Furnish Long-Term Military Aid to Ukraine.
desc: Germany said it would send Ukraine dozens of armored antiaircraft vehicles, a major shift for a country that has been reluctant to escalate the conflict with Russia.
author: John Ismay, Christopher F. Schuetze and Michael Levenson
text: As Diplomacy Hopes Dim, U.S. Marshals Allies to Furnish Long-Term Military Aid to Ukraine. Germany said it would send Ukraine dozens of armored antiaircraft vehicles, a major shift for a country that has been reluctant to escalate the conflict with Russia.

header: Emboldened by Ukraine’s Grit, U.S. Wants to See Russia Weakened.

author: Marc Santora, John Ismay and Rick Gladstone
text: Emboldened by Ukraine’s Grit, U.S. Wants to See Russia Weakened. Hours after the American secretaries of defense and state met with Ukraine’s president in Kyiv, Russia hit at least five Ukrainian railway stations in rocket attacks.

header: Standing in the path of war, a small Ukrainian town braces as Russians advance.
desc: In Orikhiv, near the front lines, most residents have fled and those who remain endure constant shelling and the fear of what comes next.
author: Michael Schwirtz and Lynsey Addario
text: Standing in the path of war, a small Ukrainian town braces as Russians advance. In Orikhiv, near the front lines, most residents have fled and those who remain endure constant shelling and the fear of what comes next.

header: Fires rip through Russian oil depots not far from the Ukrainian border.
desc: Russian state television reported two separate explosions, but officials acknowledged only one.

text: Fires rip through Russian oil depots not far from the Ukrainian border. Russian state television reported two separate explosions, but officials acknowledged only one.

header: A new U.S.-led international group will meet monthly to focus on aiding Ukraine.
desc: Defense Secretary Lloyd J. Austin III announced the formation of the Ukraine Contact Group, with more than 40 member nations, to coordinate military and humanitarian assistance.
author: John Ismay
text: A new U.S.-led international group will meet monthly to focus on aiding Ukraine. Defense Secretary Lloyd J. Austin III announced the formation of the Ukraine Contact Group, with more than 40 member nations, to coordinate military and humanitarian assistance.

header: How Zelensky Tamed Ukraine’s Fractious Politics and Stood Up to Putin.
desc: Ukrainian politics were known for sharp-elbowed infighting. But as he defends his country against the Russian invasion, President Volodymyr Zelensky has his government presenting a unified front.
author: Andrew E. Kramer
text: How Zelensky Tamed Ukraine’s Fractious Politics and Stood Up to Putin. Ukrainian politics were known for sharp-elbowed infighting. But as he defends his country against the Russian invasion, President Volodymyr Zelensky has his government presenting a unified front.

header: Explosions rattle a breakaway region in Moldova, raising fears of a broader war.
desc: The blasts in Transnistria, a region bordering Ukraine that is run by Russia-backed separatists, have fueled talk of Moldova being dragged into the war.
author: Monika Pronczuk
text: Explosions rattle a breakaway region in Moldova, raising fears of a broader war. The blasts in Transnistria, a region bordering Ukraine that is run by Russia-backed separatists, have fueled talk of Moldova being dragged into the war.

header: Putin congratulates Emmanuel Macron on his election victory in France.
desc: Mr. Macron’s opponent, Marine Le Pen, was seen in Russia as a potential game-changing option, amid the threat of new sanctions over the war in Ukraine.
author: Ivan Nechepurenko
text: Putin congratulates Emmanuel Macron on his election victory in France. Mr. Macron’s opponent, Marine Le Pen, was seen in Russia as a potential game-changing option, amid the threat of new sanctions over the war in Ukraine.

header: Roughly 15,000 Russian troops have died since the start of the war, the U.K. estimates.
author: Anushka Patil
text: Roughly 15,000 Russian troops have died since the start of the war, the U.K. estimates.

header: Americans’ support for admitting refugees is at a record high, Gallup finds.
desc: Gallup reported the record high after its new poll found that 78 percent of adults in the United States approve of allowing up to 100,000 Ukrainian refugees into the country.
author: Anushka Patil
text: Americans’ support for admitting refugees is at a record high, Gallup finds. Gallup reported the record high after its new poll found that 78 percent of adults in the United States approve of allowing up to 100,000 Ukrainian refugees into the country.

header: Ukraine War Impact Widens: Russia Cuts Gas Flow and Vows More Reprisals.
desc: New explosions across Ukraine’s borders, Russia’s shut-off of natural gas to two European nations and Moscow’s warning of additional “counterstrikes” pointed to escalating hostilities.

text: Ukraine War Impact Widens: Russia Cuts Gas Flow and Vows More Reprisals. New explosions across Ukraine’s borders, Russia’s shut-off of natural gas to two European nations and Moscow’s warning of additional “counterstrikes” pointed to escalating hostilities.

header: They Flooded Their Own Village, and Kept the Russians at Bay.
desc: The waters that poured into Demydiv were one of many instances of Ukraine wreaking havoc on its own territory to slow Russia’s advance. Residents couldn’t be happier. “We saved Kyiv,” one said.
author: NA
text: They Flooded Their Own Village, and Kept the Russians at Bay. The waters that poured into Demydiv were one of many instances of Ukraine wreaking havoc on its own territory to slow Russia’s advance. Residents couldn’t be happier. “We saved Kyiv,” one said.

text: Touring wreckage near Kyiv, the top U.N. official declares the war ‘an absurdity.’. António Guterres’ goals include securing evacuation routes for besieged civilians and supporting the prosecution of war crimes.

text: European gas prices jump after Gazprom cuts natural gas to Poland and Bulgaria. The market reaction underscored that a dreaded moment in the war had arrived: the severe disruption of Russian natural gas exports to the E.U.

header: Russian intelligence was behind an attack on the editor of Novaya Gazeta, a U.S. official says.
desc: Dmitri Muratov was on a train preparing to leave Moscow at the time of the attack, which caused chemical burns to his eyes.

text: Russian intelligence was behind an attack on the editor of Novaya Gazeta, a U.S. official says. Dmitri Muratov was on a train preparing to leave Moscow at the time of the attack, which caused chemical burns to his eyes.

text: Russia Releases Former U.S. Marine in Prisoner Swap. Trevor Reed had been detained since 2019, after he was accused of assaulting and endangering the lives of two police officers.

header: Explosions are reported in three Russian regions bordering Ukraine.

text: Explosions are reported in three Russian regions bordering Ukraine.

header: Explosions and downed drones suggest Ukraine is striking targets deeper inside Russia.

text: Explosions and downed drones suggest Ukraine is striking targets deeper inside Russia.

header: Political leaders shift rhetoric as they prepare for a protracted struggle in Ukraine.
author: Matthew Mpoke Bigg
text: Political leaders shift rhetoric as they prepare for a protracted struggle in Ukraine.

header: In a strategy shift, Russia is making slower advances in eastern Ukraine, analysts say.
author: Cora Engelbrecht

header: Kremlin Deploys New Troops to Ukraine as Both Sides Gird for a War of Attrition.
desc: Moscow is hitting fuel refineries and imperiling critical harvests, while Ukrainian forces are being buoyed by an influx of heavy weapons.
author: Marc Santora, Jane Arraf and Michael Levenson
text: Kremlin Deploys New Troops to Ukraine as Both Sides Gird for a War of Attrition. Moscow is hitting fuel refineries and imperiling critical harvests, while Ukrainian forces are being buoyed by an influx of heavy weapons.

header: Amid Hardening Western Resolve, Signs of Russia’s Stalling in Eastern Ukraine.
desc: Pentagon officials say the Russian drive in Donbas is being hampered by poor logistics and stiff Ukrainian resistance.
author: Matina Stevis-Gridneff and Thomas Gibbons-Neff
text: Amid Hardening Western Resolve, Signs of Russia’s Stalling in Eastern Ukraine. Pentagon officials say the Russian drive in Donbas is being hampered by poor logistics and stiff Ukrainian resistance.

header: A Body Bag and a Sister in Denial.
desc: The war in Ukraine is so big that it has shaken the world. But for a sister looking for her missing older brother, it was reduced to a visit to a morgue.

text: A Body Bag and a Sister in Denial. The war in Ukraine is so big that it has shaken the world. But for a sister looking for her missing older brother, it was reduced to a visit to a morgue.

header: They Survived the Holocaust. Now, They Are Fleeing to Germany.
desc: A complex operation is underway to evacuate Holocaust survivors from Ukraine. For rescuers and evacuees alike, it means confronting the past.
author: Erika Solomon
text: They Survived the Holocaust. Now, They Are Fleeing to Germany. A complex operation is underway to evacuate Holocaust survivors from Ukraine. For rescuers and evacuees alike, it means confronting the past.

header: Ukraine singles out Russian soldiers for atrocities in Bucha.
desc: In the first detailed set of allegations since the invasion, Ukrainian officials published the names and photos of Russian soldiers they say tortured civilians in a suburb of Kyiv.
author: Jeffrey Gettleman
text: Ukraine singles out Russian soldiers for atrocities in Bucha. In the first detailed set of allegations since the invasion, Ukrainian officials published the names and photos of Russian soldiers they say tortured civilians in a suburb of Kyiv.

header: The death of an American fighting for Ukraine is confirmed by his family.
desc: Willy Joseph Cancel Jr., 22, died in combat earlier this week, according to his uncle. He is believed to be the first American killed while fighting in Ukraine.
author: John Ismay and Dave Philipps
text: The death of an American fighting for Ukraine is confirmed by his family. Willy Joseph Cancel Jr., 22, died in combat earlier this week, according to his uncle. He is believed to be the first American killed while fighting in Ukraine.

header: Ukrainian Official Outlines Intentional Ambiguity on Strikes Inside Russia.
desc: The strikes have been one of the most intriguing, and opaque, new elements of the recent fighting. But when it comes to confirming their origins, “we don’t say yes and we don’t say no,’’ said the official.

text: Ukrainian Official Outlines Intentional Ambiguity on Strikes Inside Russia. The strikes have been one of the most intriguing, and opaque, new elements of the recent fighting. But when it comes to confirming their origins, “we don’t say yes and we don’t say no,’’ said the official.

header: Ukrainian officials said they found the bodies of three men in Bucha, with signs they had been ‘tortured.’.

author: Esha Ray
text: Ukrainian officials said they found the bodies of three men in Bucha, with signs they had been ‘tortured.’. A police chief said that victims’ bodies were discovered in a forest, and showed signs of mutilation.

header: Ukraine says Russia looted ancient gold artifacts from a museum.
desc: According to Ukrainian officials, Russian soldiers, aided by a mysterious expert, broke into a museum and spirited away priceless artifacts from the Scythian empire.

text: Ukraine says Russia looted ancient gold artifacts from a museum. According to Ukrainian officials, Russian soldiers, aided by a mysterious expert, broke into a museum and spirited away priceless artifacts from the Scythian empire.

header: Sunflower Oil ‘Vanishes’ as Ukraine War Grinds On.

text: Sunflower Oil ‘Vanishes’ as Ukraine War Grinds On. Several British supermarkets have joined other chains around the world in asking shoppers to limit their cooking oil purchases, as supplies dwindle and prices rise.

header: Painful Stories Emerge From Mariupol, While Combat Rages to the East.
desc: With its forces making only slow progress and enduring heavy losses, Russia now plans to annex eastern parts of Ukraine after a sham election, the U.S. says.

text: Painful Stories Emerge From Mariupol, While Combat Rages to the East. With its forces making only slow progress and enduring heavy losses, Russia now plans to annex eastern parts of Ukraine after a sham election, the U.S. says.

desc: In Mariupol, the scene of intense fighting, civilians who had taken refuge at a steel plant were at least able to begin evacuating.

text: Pelosi Visit to Ukraine Signals Growing U.S. Resolve Against Russia. In Mariupol, the scene of intense fighting, civilians who had taken refuge at a steel plant were at least able to begin evacuating.

header: They Fell Deeply in Love in Bucha. One Russian Bullet Ended It All.

text: They Fell Deeply in Love in Bucha. One Russian Bullet Ended It All. Over nearly two decades, Iryna Abramova and her husband, Oleh, built a life of love and happiness. Now, she says, she wishes the Russian soldiers had shot her, too.

header: Russian Tycoon Criticized Putin’s War. Retribution Was Swift.

header: Ukraine acknowledges that the ‘Ghost of Kyiv’ is a myth.

text: Ukraine acknowledges that the ‘Ghost of Kyiv’ is a myth. The legend of a pilot who shot down numerous Russian aircraft was one of the more successful pieces of propaganda in Ukraine’s information war.

header: A U.S. diplomat says Russia is planning to annex parts of Ukraine with ‘sham’ elections.

text: A U.S. diplomat says Russia is planning to annex parts of Ukraine with ‘sham’ elections. The official said that Russia may also try to take over parts of Ukraine by imposing “puppets and proxies” in local governments and forcing out democratically elected officials.

header: Deaths of foreign fighters draw renewed attention to the military volunteers in Ukraine.

text: Deaths of foreign fighters draw renewed attention to the military volunteers in Ukraine. At least three foreigners have been killed fighting with Ukraine’s International Legion. One analyst said many would-be volunteers underestimated the danger from Russian forces.

header: Russia’s top officer visited the front line to change the offensive’s course, U.S. and Ukraine officials say.
desc: The presence of such a high-ranking official on the front lines is highly unusual and comes amid what Western military analysts describe as increasing disarray within Russian forces.
author: Michael Schwirtz and Eric Schmitt
text: Russia’s top officer visited the front line to change the offensive’s course, U.S. and Ukraine officials say. The presence of such a high-ranking official on the front lines is highly unusual and comes amid what Western military analysts describe as increasing disarray within Russian forces.

header: In Kyiv, residents cautiously return and embrace a renewed sense of normalcy.
desc: A month after the Ukrainian Army defeated the Russian forces that had partly encircled Ukraine’s capital, tension is slowly seeping out of the city.

text: In Kyiv, residents cautiously return and embrace a renewed sense of normalcy. A month after the Ukrainian Army defeated the Russian forces that had partly encircled Ukraine’s capital, tension is slowly seeping out of the city.

author: Marc Santora
text: Zelensky says around 100 civilians are being evacuated from the Mariupol steel factory. The Ukrainian president said that civilians were being evacuated from the Azovstal steel factory and are headed to a “controlled area.”

text: As Victory Day Looms in Russia, Guesswork Grows Over Putin’s Ukraine Goals. The Russian holiday celebrating the Soviet triumph over Nazi Germany is viewed by Ukraine and NATO as a stage for the Russian president to proclaim a turn in the war.

header: Russia’s War Has Been Brutal, but Putin Has Shown Some Restraint. Why?.

text: Russia’s War Has Been Brutal, but Putin Has Shown Some Restraint. Why?. Western officials are debating the Kremlin’s calculations in not trying harder to halt weapons shipments in Ukraine. Analysts wonder whether a bigger mobilization by Moscow is on the horizon.

header: Evacuees From Mariupol’s Steel Plant Tell of Horrors and Survival.

text: Evacuees From Mariupol’s Steel Plant Tell of Horrors and Survival. Nearly 130 people reached relative safety after sheltering for weeks in dark bunkers under the Azovstal plant, under constant bombardment, with dwindling food.

header: Missiles hit power stations in Lviv and along crucial railways in central and western Ukraine.

text: Missiles hit power stations in Lviv and along crucial railways in central and western Ukraine. Altogether, six electrical substations were struck along the railways in central and western Ukraine, according to a top rail official. The rail system is the country’s lifeline for humanitarian and military supplies.

header: Saving Ukrainian Art, and Helping Artists, One NFT at a Time.

text: Saving Ukrainian Art, and Helping Artists, One NFT at a Time. Lika Spivakovska, the owner of two art galleries in Kyiv, Ukraine, has partnered with an NFT gallery in Puerto Rico to auction off pictures of art damaged and created during the war. The money will go to Ukrainian artists and other humanitarian aid.

header: Sensing a Stalled Russia, West Adds Support and Arms for Ukraine.

text: Sensing a Stalled Russia, West Adds Support and Arms for Ukraine. ‘You have exploded the myth of Putin’s invincibility,’ Prime Minister Boris Johnson of Britain told Ukrainian lawmakers, one of several Western sources of cheerleading on Tuesday.

text: For an organist from Kharkiv, performance is ‘a prayer’ in a time of despair.

text: Invoking Churchill, Boris Johnson says the war is ‘Ukraine’s finest hour.’. In the first address by a foreign leader to Ukraine’s Parliament, Britain’s prime minister burnished his credentials as a supporter of the resistance to Russia.

text: European Union Takes a Leap With a Russian Oil Embargo. The ban, once seen as unlikely, is a significant tightening of the squeeze on Russia’s economy, and a financial blow to Europe, too.

text: Turning Tables on Russia With West’s Arms, Ukraine Goes on Offense. Ukrainian forces are seeking to drive back Russian invaders from two key cities in northeast Ukraine and achieve a breakthrough in what has become a grinding battle.

text: Italy seizes a superyacht tied to Putin. Italian police boarded the yacht, the Scheherazade, late on Friday, ending what appeared to be preparations to set sail.

text: Rand Paul holds up $40 billion in aid for Ukraine. Mr. Paul had sought to alter the bill to include requiring that an inspector general monitor the spending.

text: Once Best Friends, Bulgaria Takes a Stand Against Russia. Bulgaria has imposed economic sanctions on Russia, offered to repair broken military equipment for Ukraine and expelled Russian diplomats.

text: Russia Uses Surrender in Mariupol to Portray Ukrainians as Terrorists. header: In Ukraine, Gruesome Injuries and Not Enough Doctors to Treat Them.

text: With Ukraine Taking Firmer Stance, Peace Talks Grind to a Halt. The impasse is mainly driven by Russia’s insistence on controlling large areas of Ukrainian territory. But Ukraine is also emboldened by successes on the battlefield and angry over Russian atrocities.

text: Around Kharkiv, Ukrainians Emerge to Find Lives in Ruin. After sheltering underground since February, residents of the beseiged city have finally been able to to assess the damage the Russians left behind. The discoveries have been grisly.

header: Russian and African leaders meet, one needing allies, the other grain.
desc: A meeting between President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia and the head of the African Union, President Macky Sall of Senegal, showed that Africa is not prepared to cut ties to Russia.
author: Elian Peltier
text: Russian and African leaders meet, one needing allies, the other grain. A meeting between President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia and the head of the African Union, President Macky Sall of Senegal, showed that Africa is not prepared to cut ties to Russia.

header: African Union Head Has Plea for Putin: Release Ukraine’s Grain.
desc: Amid fears of a global food crisis, the president of Senegal is to meet with the president of Russia at a Black Sea resort on Friday. Aides say he will speak of the risk of famine in Africa.
author: Elian Peltier
text: African Union Head Has Plea for Putin: Release Ukraine’s Grain. Amid fears of a global food crisis, the president of Senegal is to meet with the president of Russia at a Black Sea resort on Friday. Aides say he will speak of the risk of famine in Africa.

header: In a Museum Show, Ukraine Tells the Story of a War Still in Progress.
desc: The exhibition, called “Crucified Ukraine,” is one of several ways that the country’s government is highlighting the devastation that its people have endured.
author: Valerie Hopkins
text: In a Museum Show, Ukraine Tells the Story of a War Still in Progress. The exhibition, called “Crucified Ukraine,” is one of several ways that the country’s government is highlighting the devastation that its people have endured.

header: Thousands Swept Up as Kremlin Clamps Down on War Criticism.
desc: The arrests are a stark gauge of how the Kremlin has intensified repression of critics. At least 50 people now face years-long prison sentences.
author: Neil MacFarquhar and Alina Lobzina
text: Thousands Swept Up as Kremlin Clamps Down on War Criticism. The arrests are a stark gauge of how the Kremlin has intensified repression of critics. At least 50 people now face years-long prison sentences.

header: Dolphins Dying in Black Sea, and May Be Casualties of War, Scientists Say.
desc: The washing up of dolphins on the coasts of Bulgaria, Romania, Turkey and Ukraine is raising concerns that the war in may be interfering with marine life. But more research is needed, scientists say.
author: Marc Santora
text: Dolphins Dying in Black Sea, and May Be Casualties of War, Scientists Say. The washing up of dolphins on the coasts of Bulgaria, Romania, Turkey and Ukraine is raising concerns that the war in may be interfering with marine life. But more research is needed, scientists say.

header: The day’s military theme comes as Britain is supporting Ukraine in its war.

header: A Farmer Holds On, a Fraying Lifeline for a Besieged Corner of Ukraine.
desc: Most farmers have fled the Russian advance, but Oleksandr Chaplik has stayed, despite the lethal risks and a lack of workers, water and power.

text: A Farmer Holds On, a Fraying Lifeline for a Besieged Corner of Ukraine. Most farmers have fled the Russian advance, but Oleksandr Chaplik has stayed, despite the lethal risks and a lack of workers, water and power.

header: Russia Seeks Buyers for Plundered Ukraine Grain, U.S. Warns.
desc: American diplomats have alerted 14 countries, most in Africa, that Russian ships filled with stolen Ukrainian grain could be headed their way, posing a dilemma to countries facing dire food shortages.

text: Russia Seeks Buyers for Plundered Ukraine Grain, U.S. Warns. American diplomats have alerted 14 countries, most in Africa, that Russian ships filled with stolen Ukrainian grain could be headed their way, posing a dilemma to countries facing dire food shortages.

header: Struggling in Ukraine’s East, Russian Forces Strike in Kyiv.

author: Valerie Hopkins and Steven Erlanger
text: Struggling in Ukraine’s East, Russian Forces Strike in Kyiv. Vladimir Putin threatened “to strike targets we haven’t hit before” if Western nations proceed with plans to send long-range missiles to Ukraine.

author: Andrew E. Kramer and Jason Horowitz
text: As Battles Rage, Ukraine Rejects Macron Plea Not to ‘Humiliate’ Russia. Amid reports of battlefield gains by Ukraine, an official angrily rejected Mr. Macron’s advice, saying it “can only humiliate France.”

text: Potent Weapons Reach Ukraine Faster Than the Know-How to Use Them. Soldiers desperate for advanced arms to match their Russian enemies have resorted to Google Translate to decipher the instructions for their sophisticated new tools.

header: Battered by Russian Shells, a Monastery Remains Loyal to Moscow.
desc: The monks and nuns cloistered in a monastery complex in eastern Ukraine absorb daily bombardments from Russian artillery. And yet they remain loyal to the Russian Orthodox Church.
author: NA
text: Battered by Russian Shells, a Monastery Remains Loyal to Moscow. The monks and nuns cloistered in a monastery complex in eastern Ukraine absorb daily bombardments from Russian artillery. And yet they remain loyal to the Russian Orthodox Church.

text: Bodies of Soldiers Killed Defending Mariupol Are Returned to Ukraine. In the first official confirmed exchange of war dead, Russia and Ukraine each received about 160 bodies.

desc: Ukrainian fighters are getting increasingly sophisticated weaponry from abroad. Some have been reduced to Googling instructions.

text: High-tech Western Weapons Pose Challenge for Untrained Ukrainian Soldiers. Ukrainian fighters are getting increasingly sophisticated weaponry from abroad. Some have been reduced to Googling instructions.

author: Marc Santora
text: Guerrilla Attacks Signal Rising Resistance to Russian Occupation. Fueled by brutal Russian repression and worsening humanitarian conditions, Ukrainian partisans appear to be striking deep inside Russian-controlled territory.

header: Russia Is Racing to Cement Its Control in Southern Ukraine.

text: Russia Is Racing to Cement Its Control in Southern Ukraine. The Kremlin says it has rebuilt rail and road links to Crimea, while appointing proxy officials in an effort to create facts on the ground.

header: ‘Dead Cities’ Become the Flashpoint for the Fierce War in the East.
desc: President Volodymyr Zelensky has framed the battle in Sievierodonetsk as pivotal to the broader fight for the Donbas. Amid relentless Russian attacks, Ukraine holds on and waits for Western weapons.
author: Andrew E. Kramer and Ivor Prickett
text: ‘Dead Cities’ Become the Flashpoint for the Fierce War in the East. President Volodymyr Zelensky has framed the battle in Sievierodonetsk as pivotal to the broader fight for the Donbas. Amid relentless Russian attacks, Ukraine holds on and waits for Western weapons.

header: A Plea From German Brewers: Bring Back Your Empties.
desc: A nation of beer lovers is facing a shortage of bottles, partly because of the war in Ukraine. Breweries are looking to drinkers for a rescue.
author: Melissa Eddy
text: A Plea From German Brewers: Bring Back Your Empties. A nation of beer lovers is facing a shortage of bottles, partly because of the war in Ukraine. Breweries are looking to drinkers for a rescue.

header: Satellite Imagery Shows Ukrainian Water Flowing Again to Crimea, as Russia Nears Big Objective.
desc: Ukraine blocked a freshwater to canal to the Crimean Peninsula after Russia occupied it 2014. Moscow has fully restored the flow, easing its path to a “land bridge” with Russia, images show.
author: Anton Troianovski and Malachy Browne
text: Satellite Imagery Shows Ukrainian Water Flowing Again to Crimea, as Russia Nears Big Objective. Ukraine blocked a freshwater to canal to the Crimean Peninsula after Russia occupied it 2014. Moscow has fully restored the flow, easing its path to a “land bridge” with Russia, images show.

header: The Treasury Department bars Americans from buying Russian stocks.
desc: The measure seemed likely to have a greater impact on members of the Russian elite than on Russia’s ability to fund the war in Ukraine.
author: Alex Traub
text: The Treasury Department bars Americans from buying Russian stocks. The measure seemed likely to have a greater impact on members of the Russian elite than on Russia’s ability to fund the war in Ukraine.

header: Angela Merkel says she ‘won’t apologize’ for her Russia diplomacy.
desc: Ms. Merkel has come under fire for pushing German-Russian business interests during her tenure as chancellor.
author: Erika Solomon and Emma Bubola
text: Angela Merkel says she ‘won’t apologize’ for her Russia diplomacy. Ms. Merkel has come under fire for pushing German-Russian business interests during her tenure as chancellor.

header: Russia Opens 1,100 Cases Against Ukrainian P.O.W.s, Raising Fears of Show Trials.
desc: Announcing the invasion in February, Vladimir Putin said Ukrainians would be prosecuted for “blood crimes.” Moscow is now making good on that vow.
author: Ivan Nechepurenko
text: Russia Opens 1,100 Cases Against Ukrainian P.O.W.s, Raising Fears of Show Trials. Announcing the invasion in February, Vladimir Putin said Ukrainians would be prosecuted for “blood crimes.” Moscow is now making good on that vow.

header: As Russia tries to solidify its ‘land bridge,’ Ukraine attempts to push back in the south.
author: Marc Santora and Thomas Gibbons-Neff
text: As Russia tries to solidify its ‘land bridge,’ Ukraine attempts to push back in the south.

header: 3 Foreign Fighters in Ukraine’s Army Sentenced to Death in Russian-Held Territory.

author: Dan Bilefsky and Valerie Hopkins
text: 3 Foreign Fighters in Ukraine’s Army Sentenced to Death in Russian-Held Territory. Legal experts said the death sentences appeared calculated to discourage foreign volunteers from joining Ukraine’s military.

header: Evacuating the Vulnerable Amid the Terror of War.
desc: As Russian forces bear down on eastern Ukraine, a small army of volunteers is racing to bring to safety those unable to care for themselves.
author: Ivor Prickett and Maria Varenikova
text: Evacuating the Vulnerable Amid the Terror of War. As Russian forces bear down on eastern Ukraine, a small army of volunteers is racing to bring to safety those unable to care for themselves.

header: Shortage of Artillery Ammunition Saps Ukrainian Frontline Morale.
desc: Shells for Soviet-era weapons are running short, and powerful Western weapons are not arriving fast enough to make up the difference, giving Russia a big advantage in artillery.
author: Thomas Gibbons-Neff, Andrew E. Kramer and Natalia Yermak
text: Shortage of Artillery Ammunition Saps Ukrainian Frontline Morale. Shells for Soviet-era weapons are running short, and powerful Western weapons are not arriving fast enough to make up the difference, giving Russia a big advantage in artillery.

header: Ukraine’s banks say they are weathering the war ‘surprisingly well,’ if for now.
author: Emma Bubola
text: Ukraine’s banks say they are weathering the war ‘surprisingly well,’ if for now.

header: Behind Enemy Lines, Scouts Help Ukrainians Execute Deadly Strikes.
desc: A nascent insurgency made up of civilians or former soldiers provided information that aided Ukraine’s attack on two Russian bases, according to a senior Ukrainian military official.
author: Michael Schwirtz and Marc Santora
text: Behind Enemy Lines, Scouts Help Ukrainians Execute Deadly Strikes. A nascent insurgency made up of civilians or former soldiers provided information that aided Ukraine’s attack on two Russian bases, according to a senior Ukrainian military official.

header: Momentum in Ukraine Is Shifting in Russia’s Favor.
desc: With the Ukrainians running short of guns and ammunition, and pressures growing on Western governments, Moscow’s fortunes may be rising.
author: Marc Santora and Roger Cohen
text: Momentum in Ukraine Is Shifting in Russia’s Favor. With the Ukrainians running short of guns and ammunition, and pressures growing on Western governments, Moscow’s fortunes may be rising.

header: McDonald’s Is Back, Moscow Style, as Russian Economy Stumbles On.
desc: The reopening of the fast-food stores under Russian ownership (and with a new logo) illustrates the economy’s surprising resilience in the face of intense sanctions, though tough times lie ahead.
author: Anton Troianovski and Ivan Nechepurenko
text: McDonald’s Is Back, Moscow Style, as Russian Economy Stumbles On. The reopening of the fast-food stores under Russian ownership (and with a new logo) illustrates the economy’s surprising resilience in the face of intense sanctions, though tough times lie ahead.

header: ‘We Are Still in Shock’: A Month Trapped in a Basement by Russian Forces.
desc: More than 300 Ukrainians, 77 of them children, were imprisoned in a dank and airless school basement for nearly a month. Ten of them died.
author: Valerie Hopkins and Nicole Tung
text: ‘We Are Still in Shock’: A Month Trapped in a Basement by Russian Forces. More than 300 Ukrainians, 77 of them children, were imprisoned in a dank and airless school basement for nearly a month. Ten of them died.

header: Ukraine reiterates pleas for more weapons from the West.

header: Tough Questions for West as Ukraine Cities Teeter.
desc: Sievierodonetsk is nearly encircled. Lysychansk may be next. The momentum of the war has shifted, and Ukraine’s allies may soon start rethinking their goals.

text: Tough Questions for West as Ukraine Cities Teeter. Sievierodonetsk is nearly encircled. Lysychansk may be next. The momentum of the war has shifted, and Ukraine’s allies may soon start rethinking their goals.

header: As China Rattles Sabers, Taiwan Asks: Are We Ready for War?.
desc: Ukraine’s stubborn resistance to invasion, and the help that has poured in as a result, has both inspired Taiwan and made it rethink its own military strategy.
author: Amy Qin, Amy Chang Chien and Lam Yik Fei
text: As China Rattles Sabers, Taiwan Asks: Are We Ready for War?. Ukraine’s stubborn resistance to invasion, and the help that has poured in as a result, has both inspired Taiwan and made it rethink its own military strategy.

header: The Corpse of a Russian Soldier, and the Cold but Human Urge to Look.
desc: Why does war’s wreckage — the downed helicopters, the destroyed tanks and the dead — draw crowds? A former Marine ponders the question as he stands before the badly burned body of a Russian fighter.
author: Thomas Gibbons-Neff
text: The Corpse of a Russian Soldier, and the Cold but Human Urge to Look. Why does war’s wreckage — the downed helicopters, the destroyed tanks and the dead — draw crowds? A former Marine ponders the question as he stands before the badly burned body of a Russian fighter.

header: On Russia, Europe Weighs Competing Goals: Peace and Punishment.
desc: Arming Ukraine is not turning the tide. Is the answer vastly more weapons, as Ukraine says, or a bitter truce?
author: Steven Erlanger
text: On Russia, Europe Weighs Competing Goals: Peace and Punishment. Arming Ukraine is not turning the tide. Is the answer vastly more weapons, as Ukraine says, or a bitter truce?

header: The battle for Ukraine’s Donbas will be remembered for its brutality, Zelensky says.
author: Anushka Patil
text: The battle for Ukraine’s Donbas will be remembered for its brutality, Zelensky says.

header: Attacked at home, Boris Johnson is honored in Ukraine with a pastry in his image.
desc: A croissant is the latest homage in Ukraine to the British prime minister, who has also had a road named after him in a town near Odesa.
author: Dan Bilefsky
text: Attacked at home, Boris Johnson is honored in Ukraine with a pastry in his image. A croissant is the latest homage in Ukraine to the British prime minister, who has also had a road named after him in a town near Odesa.

header: A top Ukrainian official says urgency is missing in the West’s response to the war.
author: Andrew E. Kramer and Valerie Hopkins
text: A top Ukrainian official says urgency is missing in the West’s response to the war.

header: Control of Luhansk, and the wider Donbas region, could hinge on the battle for Sievierodonetsk.
desc: Russian-backed forces already control an estimated 80 to 90 percent of the Donbas, which is a prize for President Vladimir V. Putin.
author: Cassandra Vinograd
text: Control of Luhansk, and the wider Donbas region, could hinge on the battle for Sievierodonetsk. Russian-backed forces already control an estimated 80 to 90 percent of the Donbas, which is a prize for President Vladimir V. Putin.

header: Zelensky seeks backing for Ukraine to join the European Union.
author: Austin Ramzy
text: Zelensky seeks backing for Ukraine to join the European Union.

header: An outgunned Ukraine is adding to the pressure on Europe.
author: Steven Erlanger
text: An outgunned Ukraine is adding to the pressure on Europe.

header: U.S. and Allies Pledge Additional Arms for Ukraine, but Kyiv Wants More.
desc: Some NATO countries are wary of sending heavy weapons, hoping for a negotiated truce, but the alliance insists publicly that it is committed to helping Ukraine defeat Russia.
author: Steven Erlanger
text: U.S. and Allies Pledge Additional Arms for Ukraine, but Kyiv Wants More. Some NATO countries are wary of sending heavy weapons, hoping for a negotiated truce, but the alliance insists publicly that it is committed to helping Ukraine defeat Russia.

header: A Link to Besieged Ukrainians Is Cut, as Allies Question Strategy.
desc: The last bridge to the city of Sievierodonetsk fell as street battles raged, and some Western officials questioned Ukraine’s ability to keep resisting the Russian onslaught.
author: Thomas Gibbons-Neff and Eric Schmitt
text: A Link to Besieged Ukrainians Is Cut, as Allies Question Strategy. The last bridge to the city of Sievierodonetsk fell as street battles raged, and some Western officials questioned Ukraine’s ability to keep resisting the Russian onslaught.

header: North of Kyiv, the Russians Retreated. But the War Never Left.
desc: In the Ukrainian villages near the Russian border, shells still explode and checkpoints and trenches dot the landscape. And wary civilians live in fear the enemy will return.
author: Valerie Hopkins
text: North of Kyiv, the Russians Retreated. But the War Never Left. In the Ukrainian villages near the Russian border, shells still explode and checkpoints and trenches dot the landscape. And wary civilians live in fear the enemy will return.

header: A brutal urban artillery battle sends civilians running in eastern Ukraine.
desc: Heavy volleys between Russian forces taking control of Sievierodonetsk and Ukrainian forces in a neighboring city are leaving wreckage and growing desperation for the residents stuck there.
author: Thomas Gibbons-Neff and Natalia Yermak
text: A brutal urban artillery battle sends civilians running in eastern Ukraine. Heavy volleys between Russian forces taking control of Sievierodonetsk and Ukrainian forces in a neighboring city are leaving wreckage and growing desperation for the residents stuck there.

header: In Ukraine, a Minority Group Feels Ambivalence About the War.
desc: After Moscow’s invasion, some Ukrainians worry that divided loyalties within the country’s small ethnic Hungarian minority might make it susceptible to pro-Russia propaganda from Hungary.
author: Erika Solomon and Diego Ibarra Sanchez
text: In Ukraine, a Minority Group Feels Ambivalence About the War. After Moscow’s invasion, some Ukrainians worry that divided loyalties within the country’s small ethnic Hungarian minority might make it susceptible to pro-Russia propaganda from Hungary.

header: U.S. and NATO allies send more military aid to Ukraine to counter Russia.
desc: After announcing a major new wave of long-range weaponry for Ukraine, Western leaders will turn their sights toward other potential threats to NATO from Russia and China.
author: Steven Erlanger, Michael D. Shear and Dan Bilefsky
text: U.S. and NATO allies send more military aid to Ukraine to counter Russia. After announcing a major new wave of long-range weaponry for Ukraine, Western leaders will turn their sights toward other potential threats to NATO from Russia and China.

header: Two U.S. veterans fighting in Ukraine have gone missing, family members say.
desc: The two men, who are both from Alabama, were last seen in combat on June 9.
author: Alex Traub, Maham Javaid and Anushka Patil
text: Two U.S. veterans fighting in Ukraine have gone missing, family members say. The two men, who are both from Alabama, were last seen in combat on June 9.

header: The U.S. says it won’t pressure Ukraine to negotiate an end to the war.
author: Eric Schmitt
text: The U.S. says it won’t pressure Ukraine to negotiate an end to the war.

header: The loss of a final bridge to Sievierodonetsk may hurt Ukraine’s ability to hold its ground.
desc: The last bridge linking the eastern city with Ukrainian-controlled territory to the west has been destroyed.
author: Matthew Mpoke Bigg and Thomas Gibbons-Neff
text: The loss of a final bridge to Sievierodonetsk may hurt Ukraine’s ability to hold its ground. The last bridge linking the eastern city with Ukrainian-controlled territory to the west has been destroyed.

header: The battle for Mariupol came down to a single factory. Will Sievierodonetsk go the same way?.
desc: The United Nations says that hundreds of civilians are trapped with besieged Ukrainian forces at a chemical plant and “are suffering and experiencing constant shelling and bombardment.”
author: Matthew Mpoke Bigg
text: The battle for Mariupol came down to a single factory. Will Sievierodonetsk go the same way?. The United Nations says that hundreds of civilians are trapped with besieged Ukrainian forces at a chemical plant and “are suffering and experiencing constant shelling and bombardment.”

header: Europe Offers Ukraine a Hope of Joining the E.U., but Not a Vast Arsenal.
desc: In their first wartime visit to Kyiv, the leaders of France and Germany countered doubts about their commitment to Ukraine defeating Russia, but did not promise the weapons Ukrainians have called for.
author: Andrew E. Kramer and Michael Levenson
text: Europe Offers Ukraine a Hope of Joining the E.U., but Not a Vast Arsenal. In their first wartime visit to Kyiv, the leaders of France and Germany countered doubts about their commitment to Ukraine defeating Russia, but did not promise the weapons Ukrainians have called for.

header: Russians Breached This City, Not With Troops, but Propaganda.
desc: As they batter towns and cities in Ukraine with artillery, the Russians are also bombarding them with messaging aimed at eroding Ukrainians’ trust in their military and their government.
author: Thomas Gibbons-Neff, Natalia Yermak and Tyler Hicks
text: Russians Breached This City, Not With Troops, but Propaganda. As they batter towns and cities in Ukraine with artillery, the Russians are also bombarding them with messaging aimed at eroding Ukrainians’ trust in their military and their government.

header: A Defiant Putin Says Russia Will Flourish Without the West.
desc: In a speech at an economic forum, he called the U.S. a fading power and said sanctions on Russia, not the Ukraine war, are hurting Western economies.
author: Anton Troianovski, Andrew E. Kramer and Michael Levenson
text: A Defiant Putin Says Russia Will Flourish Without the West. In a speech at an economic forum, he called the U.S. a fading power and said sanctions on Russia, not the Ukraine war, are hurting Western economies.

header: Eurovision rules out Ukraine as host of next year’s song contest.
desc: The Eurovision Song Contest’s organizers said on Friday that Russia’s invasion meant Ukraine could not stage next year’s event, even though it won this year’s contest.
author: Alex Marshall
text: Eurovision rules out Ukraine as host of next year’s song contest. The Eurovision Song Contest’s organizers said on Friday that Russia’s invasion meant Ukraine could not stage next year’s event, even though it won this year’s contest.

header: The war in Ukraine revives an old practice: train diplomacy.
desc: With Ukraine’s airspace closed to civilian traffic since Russia’s invasion, European leaders had to take a train to Kyiv to visit President Volodymyr Zelensky.
author: Matthew Mpoke Bigg
text: The war in Ukraine revives an old practice: train diplomacy. With Ukraine’s airspace closed to civilian traffic since Russia’s invasion, European leaders had to take a train to Kyiv to visit President Volodymyr Zelensky.

header: Foreign fighters in Ukraine, many in motley groups, face perils if captured.
desc: Thousands of foreign fighters have gone to fight for Ukraine, but not all join its International Legion. Russia has maintained that some of foreign fighters it has captured are mercenaries.
author: Jane Arraf and James C. McKinley Jr.
text: Foreign fighters in Ukraine, many in motley groups, face perils if captured. Thousands of foreign fighters have gone to fight for Ukraine, but not all join its International Legion. Russia has maintained that some of foreign fighters it has captured are mercenaries.

header: Internal challenges like corruption pose challenges in Ukraine’s bid to join the E.U.
desc: The rules for joining the European Union require candidate nations crack down on corruption, a problem that Ukraine has struggled to address, including since President Volodymyr Zelensky took office.
author: Andrew E. Kramer
text: Internal challenges like corruption pose challenges in Ukraine’s bid to join the E.U. The rules for joining the European Union require candidate nations crack down on corruption, a problem that Ukraine has struggled to address, including since President Volodymyr Zelensky took office.

header: After past cease-fire deal failures, Ukraine casts a wary eye on Europe’s intent.
desc: The failed Minsk accords have become shorthand in Ukraine for appeasement of Russia. But European leaders today reiterated that any peace timeline would be in Ukraine’s hands.
author: Andrew E. Kramer
text: After past cease-fire deal failures, Ukraine casts a wary eye on Europe’s intent. The failed Minsk accords have become shorthand in Ukraine for appeasement of Russia. But European leaders today reiterated that any peace timeline would be in Ukraine’s hands.

header: The State Department says a third American fighter may be missing in Ukraine.
desc: A State Department spokesman did not provide specifics. Earlier reports that two U.S. veterans had been captured by Russian forces remain unconfirmed.
author: Anushka Patil
text: The State Department says a third American fighter may be missing in Ukraine. A State Department spokesman did not provide specifics. Earlier reports that two U.S. veterans had been captured by Russian forces remain unconfirmed.

header: Ukraine’s path to the E.U. will be long and arduous.
desc: A recommendation to grant Ukraine candidate status has important symbolism. But the country faces a difficult road ahead, including more than 80,000 pages of rules and regulations.
author: Dan Bilefsky
text: Ukraine’s path to the E.U. will be long and arduous. A recommendation to grant Ukraine candidate status has important symbolism. But the country faces a difficult road ahead, including more than 80,000 pages of rules and regulations.

header: Russian Forces Tighten Noose Around Important Cities in Ukraine’s East.

header: An assault renews concerns about a nuclear power plant on the war’s front line.
desc: Russian forces have controlled the Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant since March, but its location could make it a focus of any effort by Ukraine to regain lost territory.

text: An assault renews concerns about a nuclear power plant on the war’s front line. Russian forces have controlled the Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant since March, but its location could make it a focus of any effort by Ukraine to regain lost territory.

header: Russia plans to annex territory it controls in Ukraine, a U.S. official says.

header: Ukraine’s first lady meets with Jill Biden (and receives flowers from President Biden).

header: E.U. bans Russian gold and reimburses countries for weapons sent to Ukraine.

header: Russia fines Google for failing to remove news it calls ‘fake.’.

text: Russia fines Google for failing to remove news it calls ‘fake.’.

header: Ukraine Tries to Make the Case That It Can Win, Citing Recent Strikes.
desc: Pushing back against skepticism that Western weapons will allow them to turn the tide against Russia, Ukrainians point to successful attacks using new long-range rocket systems.

text: Ukraine Tries to Make the Case That It Can Win, Citing Recent Strikes. Pushing back against skepticism that Western weapons will allow them to turn the tide against Russia, Ukrainians point to successful attacks using new long-range rocket systems.

header: With Russian Cutoff Feared, Europeans Are Told to Curb Natural Gas Use.
desc: The European Union’s executive branch says member countries must cut consumption by 15 percent between now and the springtime to stave off a major crisis as Russia weaponizes its exports.

text: With Russian Cutoff Feared, Europeans Are Told to Curb Natural Gas Use. The European Union’s executive branch says member countries must cut consumption by 15 percent between now and the springtime to stave off a major crisis as Russia weaponizes its exports.

header: Russia Signals That It May Want a Bigger Chunk of Ukraine.
desc: A top Russian official said Moscow may extend its territorial claims to include not just the east of Ukraine but also parts of the south.

text: Russia Signals That It May Want a Bigger Chunk of Ukraine. A top Russian official said Moscow may extend its territorial claims to include not just the east of Ukraine but also parts of the south.

header: Putin is ‘entirely too healthy,’ the C.I.A. director says.
desc: There is no evidence that the Russian president is unwell, Western intelligence officials said, after the Kremlin denied rumors about his health.

text: Putin is ‘entirely too healthy,’ the C.I.A. director says. There is no evidence that the Russian president is unwell, Western intelligence officials said, after the Kremlin denied rumors about his health.

header: Russia’s territorial aims in Ukraine have expanded, the foreign minister says.

text: Russia’s territorial aims in Ukraine have expanded, the foreign minister says. Mr. Lavrov said that Russia’s objectives could expand further if Western countries deliver more long-range weapons to Ukraine.

header: Seeking ‘Axis of Good’ Against U.S., Russia Taps Allies of Convenience.

text: Seeking ‘Axis of Good’ Against U.S., Russia Taps Allies of Convenience. A trilateral meeting of the leaders of Iran, Russia and Turkey seemed to suggest a new anti-American alliance. But there are major fissures between the countries, too.

header: Ukraine steps up attacks on key Russian targets in the south.

text: Ukraine steps up attacks on key Russian targets in the south. Attacks on a strategically important bridge and other Russian positions in the Kherson Province over the last two days raise a question: Is Ukraine preparing a larger counteroffensive?

text: Turkey says a deal between Ukraine and Russia to unblock grain exports will be signed on Friday.

header: Ukraine’s first lady tells the U.S. Congress that ‘Russia is destroying our people.’.
desc: In a rare appearance by a foreign first spouse before Congress, Olena Zelenska asked for more weapons to defend against Russian aggression.
author: Dan Bilefsky, Stephanie Lai and Jim Tankersley
text: Ukraine’s first lady tells the U.S. Congress that ‘Russia is destroying our people.’. In a rare appearance by a foreign first spouse before Congress, Olena Zelenska asked for more weapons to defend against Russian aggression.

header: Russia Restarts Gas Shipments Through Pipeline, but Keeps Germany Guessing.
desc: Russia is again sending natural gas through the Nord Stream 1 pipeline to Germany, but nobody knows how much and how long the fuel will flow.

text: Russia Restarts Gas Shipments Through Pipeline, but Keeps Germany Guessing. Russia is again sending natural gas through the Nord Stream 1 pipeline to Germany, but nobody knows how much and how long the fuel will flow.

header: Russia Agrees to Let Ukraine Ship Grain, Easing World Food Shortage.

text: Russia Agrees to Let Ukraine Ship Grain, Easing World Food Shortage. Ukraine and Russia signed a deal to lift Russia’s blockade of Ukrainian ports, which has worsened a global food crisis — their most important agreement since the war began.

header: Last Stand at Azovstal: Inside the Siege That Shaped the Ukraine War.
desc: For 80 days, at a sprawling steelworks, a relentless Russian assault met unyielding Ukrainian resistance. This is how it was for those who fought, and for those trapped beneath the battlefield.

text: Last Stand at Azovstal: Inside the Siege That Shaped the Ukraine War. For 80 days, at a sprawling steelworks, a relentless Russian assault met unyielding Ukrainian resistance. This is how it was for those who fought, and for those trapped beneath the battlefield.

header: Russia Strikes Odesa Port, Stirring Doubts on Deal to Export Grain.

text: Russia Strikes Odesa Port, Stirring Doubts on Deal to Export Grain. The string of explosions in Ukraine’s most important port came less than 24 hours after the two countries struck a deal on grain shipments, and prompted accusations from Ukrainian leaders that Russia could not be trusted.

text: Boats and a bridge: Control of waterways will be key in Ukraine’s looming counteroffensive. The Biden administration is sending aid to help in the effort to recapture Kherson.

header: The Biden administration will send another $270 million in military aid to Ukraine.

header: Spouses of world leaders to join Ukraine’s first lady in a discussion on postwar lives.
author: Maham Javaid
text: Spouses of world leaders to join Ukraine’s first lady in a discussion on postwar lives.

header: Russia and Ukraine trade attacks as fighting shifts to the south.

text: Russia and Ukraine trade attacks as fighting shifts to the south.

header: Eyeing a City Captured by Russia, Ukraine Prepares an Ambitious Counterattack.
desc: With soldiers, artillery and subversives, Ukraine has been laying the groundwork to retake Kherson, which Russia has held for months. But a counterattack would require huge resources, and could come at a heavy toll.

text: Eyeing a City Captured by Russia, Ukraine Prepares an Ambitious Counterattack. With soldiers, artillery and subversives, Ukraine has been laying the groundwork to retake Kherson, which Russia has held for months. But a counterattack would require huge resources, and could come at a heavy toll.

text: U.K., Eurovision Runner-up to Ukraine, Will Host Song Contest in 2023. Organizers had ruled out Ukraine from hosting next year because of safety concerns from Russia’s invasion.

header: A U.S. intelligence report finds that Russia’s use of ‘filtration centers’ to detain and deport Ukrainians has intensified.

text: A U.S. intelligence report finds that Russia’s use of ‘filtration centers’ to detain and deport Ukrainians has intensified. A newly declassified U.S. analysis found that Ukrainians detained in the centers may face deportation or imprisonment.

text: Fears rise for a rights activist captured while fighting for Ukraine. Russian propaganda has demonized Maksym Butkevych, a former journalist and campaigner who was taken prisoner in the eastern city of Sievierodonetsk.

text: ‘We Survived Another Night’: In Ruined Suburb, Solace in a Small Community. In a largely abandoned apartment complex on the outskirts of Kharkiv, Ukraine’s second-biggest city, the people who stayed behind find comfort in their surroundings and each other.

header: ‘An abyss of fear’: A report accuses Russia of further abuses against civilians.
desc: Human Rights Watch cataloged a litany of torture, inhumane treatment, arbitrary detention and disappearances in southern Ukraine and said that the atrocities could amount to war crimes.

text: ‘An abyss of fear’: A report accuses Russia of further abuses against civilians. Human Rights Watch cataloged a litany of torture, inhumane treatment, arbitrary detention and disappearances in southern Ukraine and said that the atrocities could amount to war crimes.

header: Kyiv Nightlife Comes Back Amid Urge for Contact. ‘This Is the Cure.’.
desc: Frenzied raves. Crowded bars (with free therapy). And of course, cuddle parties. Nightlife is returning to Ukraine’s capital. But revelers still have to reckon with guilty feelings. Plus curfew.

text: An American killed in Ukraine was moved to volunteer by his heritage, a friend says. Joining the fight “was something that he needed to do,” a close friend said of Luke Lucyszyn.

author: Carly Olson
text: Bryan Young, an American volunteer who died fighting in Ukraine, felt called to help. After resettling in the Republic of Georgia, Young traveled to Ukraine to enlist as a volunteer fighter.

header: Ukraine presses on with a plan for much-needed grain shipments after a Russian attack.

text: Ukraine presses on with a plan for much-needed grain shipments after a Russian attack.

header: The Hunt Is On for ‘War Trophies’ in Ukraine.
desc: Collectors across the country are seeking pieces of shrapnel, bits of bombs and even the uniforms of dead Russians. It’s part of an urge to feel more directly connected to the cause.

text: The Hunt Is On for ‘War Trophies’ in Ukraine. Collectors across the country are seeking pieces of shrapnel, bits of bombs and even the uniforms of dead Russians. It’s part of an urge to feel more directly connected to the cause.

header: Navigating mines and threatened by war, ships laden with grain are expected to leave Odesa soon.
desc: Such voyages would be the first since the signing of a deal to allow a resumption of Ukraine’s grain exports, which have been blocked since Russia’s invasion five months ago.

text: Navigating mines and threatened by war, ships laden with grain are expected to leave Odesa soon. Such voyages would be the first since the signing of a deal to allow a resumption of Ukraine’s grain exports, which have been blocked since Russia’s invasion five months ago.

header: Britain’s Power Grid Warns of a Tight Energy Supply This Winter.
desc: Unlike many European countries, Britain produces substantial amounts of its own gas, but it has still faced skyrocketing energy prices in recent months.
author: Alex Traub
text: Britain’s Power Grid Warns of a Tight Energy Supply This Winter. Unlike many European countries, Britain produces substantial amounts of its own gas, but it has still faced skyrocketing energy prices in recent months.

text: Ukraine hits a key bridge in Kherson as Russia steps up missile strikes across the south. The bridge is a critical part of Russia’s resupply route for the forces charged with holding the port city.

header: Looming Question for Putin Opponents: Can You Change Russia From Jail?.

text: Looming Question for Putin Opponents: Can You Change Russia From Jail?. For opposition figures choosing to stay in Russia after President Vladimir V. Putin’s invasion of Ukraine, imprisonment looks like a matter of time. It’s also a subject for fierce debate.

header: Facing ‘Putin’s Energy Blackmail,’ Europe Agrees to Cut Russian Gas Use.

text: Facing ‘Putin’s Energy Blackmail,’ Europe Agrees to Cut Russian Gas Use. Holding together despite some nations’ dependence on Russia, the European Union agreed to make voluntary savings mandatory if the Kremlin suddenly decides to turn off the taps over its invasion of Ukraine.

text: A joint center to monitor grain shipments from Ukraine opens in Istanbul.

header: The war has sent prices in Ukraine soaring.

text: The war has sent prices in Ukraine soaring.

text: A special military group in Germany keeps the West’s weapons flowing into Ukraine. A little-known group at U.S. European Command in Germany fills Ukraine’s battlefield requests with donations from more than 40 countries.

header: Macron criticizes the ‘hypocrisy’ of some African leaders on the Ukraine war.

text: Macron criticizes the ‘hypocrisy’ of some African leaders on the Ukraine war. President Emmanuel Macron of France, visiting West Africa, said some countries had failed to condemn Russia’s invasion of Ukraine because of “diplomatic pressures.”

text: Why does Ukraine fight? So it can exist, Zelensky says. Ukraine is celebrating its Day of Statehood, a holiday that both celebrates its independence and sends an unmistakable message to a neighbor with territorial ambitions.

text: Blinken and Lavrov Discuss Griner in Their First Call of the War. Ukraine said it was ready for Black Sea grain shipments to resume, while the top Russian and American diplomats talked about a prisoner swap involving the basketball star Brittney Griner.

text: Lethal missile strikes in Kharkiv hit sites related to Ukraine’s military, a new pattern.

header: Lebanon says it is investigating Ukraine’s claim that a docked ship contains plundered grain.

header: A Ukrainian appeals court reduces the life sentence of a Russian soldier tried for war crimes.

header: A strike kills dozens of Ukrainian prisoners of war. Russia and Ukraine blame each other.

text: A strike kills dozens of Ukrainian prisoners of war. Russia and Ukraine blame each other.

text: Iran Ramps Up Drone Exports, Signaling Global Ambitions. Tehran has quietly stepped up the sale of drone technology to countries outside the Middle East as it seeks to become a player in the international market.

header: Ukraine’s harvest is underway, swelling its grain backlog and adding to farmers’ troubles.

text: Ukraine’s harvest is underway, swelling its grain backlog and adding to farmers’ troubles.

header: Using Nuclear Reactors for Cover, Russians Lob Rockets at Ukrainians.
