text: Using Nuclear Reactors for Cover, Russians Lob Rockets at Ukrainians. Russia has turned Europe’s largest nuclear power plant into a fortress, stymying Ukraine’s forces and unnerving locals who fear both shelling and a radiation leak.

header: How the Kremlin Is Forcing Ukrainians to Adopt Russian Life.

text: How the Kremlin Is Forcing Ukrainians to Adopt Russian Life. In Russian-occupied regions in Ukraine, local leaders are forcing civilians to accept Russian rule. Next come sham elections that would formalize Vladimir V. Putin’s claim that they are Russian territories.

text: One of Ukraine’s richest businessmen is killed in the port city of Mykolaiv. Oleksiy Vadaturskyi, whose company built storage facilities and infrastructure necessary for exporting grain, was killed with his wife in a missile strike.

header: As Ukraine defends in the east and south, a U.S. official says Russia’s war effort is failing.

text: As Ukraine defends in the east and south, a U.S. official says Russia’s war effort is failing. A senior U.S. Defense Department official said there was growing evidence that steep Russian losses had left some units ill-prepared to fight.

text: As Ukraine Orders Civilians to Evacuate the East, Residents Face a Grim Choice. The president’s announcement is the broadest government directive issued thus far in the war, coming after months of relentless Russian bombardment.

text: Ukraine Calls for Investigation Into Prisoner Deaths as Outrage Grows. Ukrainian authorities gathered evidence that they said showed Russia had orchestrated an explosion that killed at least 50 of their soldiers.

text: Vessels await word that they can carry the first grain shipments out of Ukraine.

text: Ukrainian officials compile evidence that they say shows Russia was behind prison camp blast. Dozens of Ukrainian soldiers being held in a Russian prisoner of war camp were killed when a blast tore through their barracks.

header: Ukraine Ships Grain at Last. It Will Take Far More to Slow Global Hunger.

text: Ukraine Ships Grain at Last. It Will Take Far More to Slow Global Hunger. The departure of a grain-filled vessel from Odesa was hailed as a victory against global hunger. But experts say the crisis is so big that no single advance can reverse it.

header: In Ukraine, Devastation Spreads as Russia Regroups for New Offensive.

text: In Ukraine, Devastation Spreads as Russia Regroups for New Offensive. The U.S. has announced $550 million in additional arms for Ukraine as it gears up to defend its eastern regions, which Ukrainian officials have asked civilians to flee before winter.

text: Living Side by Side, Ukrainian and Russian Sailors Are Tested by War. Sailors are accustomed to not discussing politics at sea, but the war between the two countries has made that more difficult.

header: Zelensky says Ukraine’s government may allow civil partnerships for same-sex couples.

text: War Spurs Ukrainian Efforts to Legalize Same-Sex Marriage. The role of gay soldiers, the lack of legal rights for their partners, and the threat of Russia imposing anti-L.G.B.T. policies have turned the war into a catalyst for change in Ukraine.

header: Ukraine wages a ‘deep war’ to degrade Russian forces as Moscow continues its scorched-earth campaign.

text: Ukraine wages a ‘deep war’ to degrade Russian forces as Moscow continues its scorched-earth campaign. An attack on a train over the weekend was the latest in a series of strikes that have disrupted Russian logistical efforts and inflicted grave losses.

header: The U.S. imposes a new round of sanctions on Russians, including a woman close to Putin.

text: The U.S. imposes a new round of sanctions on Russians, including a woman close to Putin. Many of the targets are already under sanctions imposed by the European Union and Britain. header: Taiwan and Ukraine: Two crises, 5,000 miles apart, are linked in complex ways.

text: Taiwan and Ukraine: Two crises, 5,000 miles apart, are linked in complex ways. The fear since the start of the war in Ukraine has been that Moscow and Beijing will be driven closer as the United States casts both issues as a struggle between authoritarianism and democracy.

header: Ukraine Attacks Russia Along Northern Front, Swiftly Making Gains.

text: For Ukraine, the Fight Is Often a Game of Bridges. The southern counteroffensive has been a painstaking battle of river crossings, with pontoon bridges as prime targets for both sides. But so far, it is Ukraine that has advanced.

text: Ukrainian Offensive Seen as Reshaping the War’s Contours. The fall of the strategically important city of Izium, in Ukraine’s east, is the most devastating blow to Russia since its humiliating retreat from Kyiv.

text: Russia says that a senior Chinese official expressed support for the invasion of Ukraine. The comments are the clearest sign of support from China, which has preferred to stay on the sidelines and maintain ties with both Russia and Europe, without alienating either.

text: In Retreat at the Front, Russia Strikes Deep Into Ukraine. In an attack in central Ukraine, Russian forces used what Ukrainians said were Iranian-made drones acquired by Moscow as its own arsenal dwindles.

header: Ukraine’s top diplomat tries to counter Russia’s narrative on Africa tour.

text: With Attacks on Ukraine, Putin Gives Hard-Liners What They Wanted. A sharp shift toward deadly strikes signaled that domestic pressure over Russia’s flailing war effort had escalated to the point where Vladimir Putin felt a decisive show of force was necessary.

header: Multiple Russian Strikes Wreak Havoc in Ukraine.

text: Multiple Russian Strikes Wreak Havoc in Ukraine. President Vladimir Putin ordered a series of missile strikes against cities across Ukraine, killing at least 14 people. It was the broadest aerial assault against civilians and critical infrastructure since the early days of Moscow’s invasion.

text: In Kyiv, the strikes shattered what had become a relative sense of calm. Russia’s attacks on Ukraine’s capital on Monday came after months in which the fighting had shifted to other parts of the country.

text: A Wagner fighter defects to Norway, promising to expose Russian war crimes in Ukraine. The rare defection by a former member of the notorious Russian paramilitary force could aid investigations into Moscow’s atrocities.
